job_title: Conversational  Study – Seeking Consultation from  or NLP PhD
job_description:
Hello! I'm conducting independent research on ethical conversational  and am looking for a technically fluent consultant with a background in  , Natural Language Processing, or Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) — ideally at the PhD level or equivalent. (I am hoping to use my research for proof-of-concept or a research proposal to apply to PhD programs myself.)

The Work
I’ve developed a web-based chatbot framework using GPT-based APIs (gpt-3.5 and gpt-4), HTML/JS, and scenario-based prompts for a university research project. The bots are designed to support distinct conversational goals in a controlled A/B test format. 

I now want to refine study, namely my methodology and bot behaviors, to:
- Ensure greater behavioral differentiation between chatbot variants
- Improve conversational quality and naturalness within ethical guidelines
- Adjust prompt logic for more consistent user engagement and reflection
- Tighten my study design to support clearer results in future iterations

What You’ll Be Doing
- Review sample prompts and system instructions (already built)
- Offer strategic feedback on  prompt design and architecture
- Advise on how to maximize LLM capabilities for conversational nuance
- Discuss limitations of current API-based implementations (Open models)
- Help me clarify experimental logic for a short-form next iteration

🧠 Ideal Background
- PhD or advanced graduate work in CS, , NLP, or HCI
- Familiarity with GPT model behavior and prompt engineering best practices
- Research or design experience with chatbots, language agents, or ethical 
- Comfort offering concise, actionable feedback on experimental design
- Familiarity with academic research (and maybe academic research study design)

⏱️ Scope
1–2 hour consultation (Zoom or message-based) to start, most likely. May lead to future sessions depending on your interest/expertise.

Thank you!

job_title: Detail-oriented annotators needed for an open-source  web assistant project
job_description:
Note: we will begin reviewing proposals the week of March 10th, 2025, at which time you can expect to hear from the team. 

We are researchers with the Multimodal team at 2, a non-profit  research institute. Our team is responsible for groundbreaking work such as Objaverse, Molmo and more. We are looking to hire at least 5 motivated, detail-oriented, tech-savvy annotators for a data-collecting and data-entry task to support an open-source intelligent web assistant development and research project.  

Participants will be provided with research accounts and will be tasked with navigating the web and taking dynamic actions on a diverse set of websites including creating research accounts and logging into a variety of platforms where actions such as shopping, searching, booking and more may take place. These actions will be captured via screen recordings and keyboard and mouse inputs for the purpose of training a web assistant that can help users with everyday web browsing activities similar to Google’s Mariner, or Open’s Operator (users will NOT be recorded at any point). Participants will also  be asked to review the captured recordings and generated summaries of the actions taken to ensure accuracy and add any additional details or context as needed. Participants will be provided the necessary information to complete these research tasks and are required NOT to use their personal information.

Ideal candidates will be technically savvy with experience using a variety of technologies and applications including web extensions and note taking apps. Prior experience with similar data collection work and annotation tasks is highly desirable. A solid internet connection is required for this task. (candidates must be 18 years of age or older)

We estimate that this project will take approximately 30 - 40 hours a week over the course of about two months. This estimate includes one hour for reading the guidelines and completing a paid screening task, which will be used to evaluate your work quality and decide whether to extend the contract beyond the screening task, to the ~2 month contract. This project can be completed fully remotely.

Upon confirming the engagement, you will be asked to sign 2’s Upwork Project Agreement outlining the terms and conditions of your participation in this project.

to Begin” UX with assistant intro - Bottom nav or simple card interface

input + MediaPipe) - Skin Photo Tool (image upload or camera + basic image classifier) - Oral Health
Tool (camera + guided image capture)

text-based guidance)

job_title: Full-Stack Developer Needed –  Photo Processing  - (Think Imagen )
job_description:
READ FIRST – DO NOT APPLY UNLESS THIS FITS YOU:
We’re looking for a full-stack developer with real experience in -driven photo processing, image variation rendering, and custom file generation.

Your technical skillset must be comparable to what’s required to build something like Imagen  — NOT just form handling or web dashboards.

If you’ve never built a product that involves:
	•	Real-time or batch photo editing/processing
	•	 or algorithm-based visual transformations
	•	Generating downloadable, structured files based on user content
Do not apply.

You’ll be asked to show examples of your previous work in this space — no exceptions.

⸻

Project Overview:
We’re building a browser-based tool that accepts user input (prompt or reference), processes 3–5 uploaded images, applies 3–5 visual style variations, and returns downloadable results after payment.

The project involves:
	•	Image upload and storage
	•	 input parsing (Open or similar)
	•	Image processing (multiple variation outputs)
	•	Dynamic file generation (.xmp or similar)
	•	Stripe integration
	•	Final download delivery

⸻

Tech Required (No Substitutes):
	•	React or Next.js (frontend)
	•	Python (FastAPI, Flask) or Node.js (backend)
	•	OpenCV or PIL (for photo manipulation)
	•	Experience with  APIs (e.g., Open, Stability, Replicate)
	•	Experience generating structured files (XML, .xmp, .json, etc.)
	•	Stripe integration (one-time purchases)
	•	AWS S3 (or equivalent) for image/file handling

⸻

Milestones:
	1.	Build basic frontend with input UI + image upload
	2.	Set up variation logic + process preview pipeline
	3.	Display preview images (multiple versions per input image)
	4.	Payment flow + file generation + download
	5.	(Optional) Advanced: upload a photo, reverse engineer the look, output new variations

⸻

REPEATING THIS AGAIN – DO NOT APPLY UNLESS:
	•	You have built photo processing tools comparable in complexity to Imagen 
	•	You can show visual/image-based project samples
	•	You’ve worked with  APIs and image manipulation at this level
	•	You’re confident building from scratch without a design file

⸻

To Apply:

	•	Include your preferred tech stack
	•	Estimate time per milestone or total
	•	Be ready to sign an NDA

job_title: Seeking Agentic  Developer (Senior) for Tech Leadership Opportunity
job_description:
ABOUT US
We are a technology services firm focused on helping mid-market companies ($10M-$1B revenue) define, prioritize, and implement their  strategies. 

We bridge the gap between future potential and present capabilities by providing "agent development as a service" to clients seeking to leverage  within their workflows.


THE OPPORTUNITY
We're seeking an exceptional technical leader to partner with us in building our  agent development practice. This is not a traditional employment role, but rather a collaborative partnership opportunity that could evolve into a Head of Development position as our relationship and business grow. You'll be instrumental in shaping our technical vision, leading agent development initiatives, and building our capabilities from the ground up for our mid-market clients across healthcare and financial services sectors.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
+ Lead the technical vision and implementation of our  agent development practice
+ Present technical solutions to clients and participate in business development activities
+ Build and manage a team of developers as we grow
+ Design and develop custom  agents using both code-based and no-code approaches
+ Build scalable agent architectures that integrate with clients' existing systems
+ Mentor junior developers and guide cross-functional teams on agent development
+ Evaluate and incorporate emerging  tools and frameworks into our development stack
+ Collaborate with clients to understand their workflows and translate requirements into effective agent solutions
+ Establish best practices for agent development, testing, deployment, and monitoring
+ Create documentation and knowledge sharing processes for client handoff

TECHNICAL EXPERTISE
Agent Development: 
Expert-level experience designing and developing  agents using various frameworks including LangChain, LlamaIndex, Auto-GPT, or equivalent

No-Code & Low-Code Tools: 
Demonstrated experience with no-code  agent platforms such as n8n, Make.com, and similar tools 

LLM Experience: 
Hands-on experience integrating commercial LLMs (Open GPT-4/3.5, Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini) and open-source models (Llama 3, Mistral) via Hugging Face and other repositories

Enterprise  Platforms: 
Experience with enterprise  platforms such as Amazon Bedrock and/or Google Vertex  is a significant plus

Programming Languages: 
Strong proficiency in Python, with experience using Python libraries like LangChain, Pydantic, and various LLM integration tools

LLM Integration: 
Deep understanding of LLM integration patterns, prompt engineering, and optimization techniques
Architecture Design: Experience designing  agent architectures that can be deployed across diverse client environments

API Development: 
Skills in creating and integrating with RESTful APIs for agent connectivity

Data Handling: 
Experience with data preprocessing, vector databases (like Pinecone, Weaviate, or Chroma), embedding techniques, and retrieval patterns

Security & Compliance: 
Knowledge of security best practices for  systems, particularly in regulated industries like healthcare and finance


QUALIFICATIONS 
+ 7+ years of software development experience, with at least 3 years focused on /ML systems
+ 2+ years of experience specifically with LLM applications and agent development
+ Experience managing technical teams and leading development projects
+ Proven ability to present technical concepts to business audiences and participate in sales processes
+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (advanced degree preferred)
+ Strong portfolio demonstrating successful  agent development projects
+ Fluent English communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to translate technical concepts for business audiences
US-based, preferably in New York or Northeast region (for occasional in-person meetings)

Experience in healthcare or financial services industries is a significant plus

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE 
You're a versatile technologist with a track record of building and leading technical teams. You can move fluidly between code-heavy development and no-code tools to create the right solution for each client. 

You're equally comfortable deep-diving into Python code, rapidly prototyping with visual tools, or presenting technical concepts to executives. 

You have hands-on experience building and deploying  agents for real business use cases and understand both the technical implementation details and the business outcomes  agents can deliver. Most importantly, you can articulate complex technical solutions in a way that helps clients understand the value, which contributes directly to business development efforts.

WHAT WE OFFER 
+ Equity Partnership: Opportunity to join as a technical partner with equity participation 
+ Leadership Role: Shape and lead our  development practice with potential to grow into Head of Development
+ Business Building: Help build a cutting-edge  services business from the ground up
+ Client Relationships: Direct involvement with clients and strategic decision-making
+ Flexible Arrangement: Structure our collaboration in a way that works for both parties
+ Remote-First: Work virtually with occasional in-person collaboration
+ Industry Exposure: Work across diverse industries and  use cases
+ Continuous Innovation: Stay at the forefront of  agent development

HOW TO CONNECT 
We're looking for a true partner, not just a contractor or employee. If you're excited about building something significant in the  space and want to discuss how we might collaborate, please reach out with:

+ Your professional background/resume
+ Brief overview of your  agent development experience
+ Links to relevant portfolio items or examples of your work
+ Your vision for how we might structure a partnership
+ Your availability for an initial conversation

We are committed to building a diverse team and strongly encourage connections from historically underrepresented groups in technology.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using  agents in your work as a Tax Examiner
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying   (). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want  agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Tax Examiners/Collectors/Revenue Agents or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are  agents?

An  agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about  agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop  agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

    • Provide technical expertise for investor pitches and grant applications.
Requirements:
    • Experience in developing handheld ultrasound devices (hardware & software integration).
    • Strong background in /ML for medical imaging (deep learning, image segmentation).
    • Expertise in ultrasound signal processing and real-time image enhancement.
    • Knowledge of FDA/CE regulatory standards for medical devices.
    • Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar  frameworks.
    • Experience with wireless data transmission and remote physician access systems is a plus.
    • NOTE: This project requires advanced proficiency in Python, particularly in image processing, custom model development, data training, and hardware integration with complex algorithms. As I do not possess advanced Python skills in these areas, I will not be able to contribute to that aspect of the project. 

App Version / Solution

a. iOS native app (with potential for Android development in the future)
b. iPad-specific design in optimization
c. Backend would be build using PHP / Mysql
d. App in portrait mode only and Landscape mode if possible.
e. No dark mode considered

Compensation varies, with potential for equity in the company.

job_title: Generative  Agent Architect
job_description:
We’re looking for a forward‑thinking Generative  Agent Architect to design and implement advanced, collaborative agent frameworks that power next‑generation applications. You will lead efforts to define, build, and orchestrate fleets of intelligent agents—leveraging LangChain, LangGraph, and crew‑based architectures—to solve complex business problems and deliver high‑velocity innovation.

Key Responsibilities
Agent Framework Design: Architect end‑to‑end agent pipelines using LangChain and LangGraph, defining clear interfaces, data flows, and orchestration patterns.

Multi‑Agent Collaboration: Build and coordinate “agent crews” that work in parallel or series—delegating tasks, sharing context, and resolving conflicts to achieve a unified goal.

Core Agent Development: Implement custom agents for retrieval, reasoning, planning, execution, and user interaction, fine‑tuning LLMs and embedding models as needed.

Crew Orchestration: Design supervisory “master” agents and interaction protocols (queues, event buses, or graph triggers) to synchronize agent teams in real time.

Infrastructure & DevOps: Containerize agent services (Docker/Kubernetes), set up CI/CD pipelines for model and code deployments, and integrate automated testing for agent behaviors.

Scalability & Monitoring: Ensure high availability and low latency through auto‑scaling clusters, robust logging/metrics (Prometheus/Grafana), and drift‑detection across agent networks.

Security & Compliance: Enforce secure communication, credential vaulting (HashiCorp Vault), and data encryption in flight and at rest for all agent interactions.

Collaboration & Leadership: Partner with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to translate business requirements into modular agent solutions; mentor junior developers in agent best practices.

Must‑Have Skills & Experience
Agent Frameworks: 3+ years hands‑on with LangChain and LangGraph (or equivalent graph‑based orchestration libraries).

Multi‑Agent Systems: Proven track record designing and deploying collaborative agent crews, including master–worker and peer‑to‑peer topologies.

LLM Expertise: Deep experience fine‑tuning and integrating large language models (Open, Anthropic, or open‑source) for retrieval‑augmented and planning use cases.

CI/CD & MLOps: Strong DevOps background on one or more hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP) for automated build, test, and deploy of agent services.

Containerization & Orchestration: Expert in Docker, Kubernetes, Helm; comfortable defining StatefulSets, Jobs, and custom operators for agent workloads.

Event‑Driven Architectures: Solid understanding of message buses (Kafka, RabbitMQ) or serverless event triggers for inter‑agent communication.

Security Best Practices: Experience implementing RBAC, secrets management, and network policies in production environments.

Collaboration: Exceptional written and verbal communication, capable of leading cross‑functional design reviews and knowledge‑sharing sessions.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using  agents in your work as a Compliance Officer
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying   (). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want  agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work Compliance Officer or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are  agents?

An  agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about  agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop  agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

Machine learning project (rule based and LSTM)

My kid and I (We have no idea what we are doing) were building a crypto asset price engines, they pulled the data using Binance.us API (has to be USA). They display and logged the prices for BTC, ETH, SOL, BNB. We were doing it for fun using Grok  mostly, some Cursor for frontend.

To avoid having to figure out what we broke on our own my desktop that we built the engines on, I am buying my kid his own desktop to run the scripts on. So we need you to help us or tell us everything to install (pip install packages) to get our engines running again. 

My kid and I worked 6 weeks on these (something a developer could possibly do in a few hours) but its means a lot to ME, even though I know its nothing fancy.. This is more about something we built together and I want to see it work again (and I know my kid does too). (plus we used Coinbase to start and switched to Binance later)

windows computer

job_title: Azure  & Power Automate LinkedIn Video Summarizer and LinkedIN Post Generator
job_description:
### **Part I: Content Download and Upload Facilitation**

**Objective:**

This part is designed to gather and analyze textual content from various sources, including LinkedIn and Medium, to determine the user’s distinct writing style. This system provides foundational analytics that help in enhancing personal and professional engagement through targeted content recommendations.

**Features:**

1. **Multi-Source Integration:**
    - **Automated and Manual Content Retrieval:** Depending on the platform’s API constraints, the system either automatically retrieves content or guides users to manually upload their posts. For LinkedIn and Medium, where direct access might be limited, the platform will include comprehensive guides on how to export posts. This feature ensures that all relevant content, whether accessible via API or through manual uploads, is captured and analyzed.
2. **Advanced Text Analysis for Writing Style Insights:**
    - **In-depth Content Evaluation:** Utilizing Azure Cognitive Services, this feature performs a thorough analysis of the text to extract sentiment, key phrases, and stylistic elements. By evaluating these elements, the platform can pinpoint characteristic patterns and suggest modifications to enhance readability and engagement. It also assesses the emotional tone and structural aspects of the writing to provide detailed feedback on how these elements influence reader engagement.
3. **User Interaction and Data Handling:**
    - **Interactive User Dashboard:** Built with Power Apps, this dashboard allows users to upload or schedule content to LinkedIn, view detailed analyses, and receive personalized writing advice. The dashboard is designed to be user-friendly, catering to both tech-savvy users and those with minimal technical background.
    - **Secure Data Management:** Ensures that all user data is handled securely, with robust encryption and compliance measures in place. Azure Blob Storage is used for data storage, providing a secure and scalable solution for managing large volumes of data.
4. **Scalable and Accessible Platform Design:**
    - **Flexible Cloud Architecture:** The platform is built on Azure, providing high scalability to handle varying loads from individual users to large corporations. This scalability ensures that as user demand increases, the system can dynamically adjust resources without compromising performance.
    - **Accessibility and Inclusion:** Special attention is given to making the platform accessible, incorporating features like screen reader support, alternative text, and keyboard navigation options to ensure that all users can efficiently use the application.

### **Part II: Video Processing and Content Generation**

**Objective:**

This section handles video content processing and leverages both textual and visual insights to generate new, engaging content ideas. It integrates with the insights derived from the writing style analysis to offer a comprehensive content strategy tool.

**Features:**

1. **Dropbox Integration for Video Management:**
    - **Efficient File Transfer Protocol:** Monitors locally produced OBS video files and transfers them from Dropbox to Azure Blob Storage based on predefined conditions, such as file age and type, ensuring that the files are completely uploaded and closed before they are processed.
2. **Comprehensive Video Content Analysis:**
    - **Dual-component Processing:** Utilizes Azure Media Services to separate audio and visual components of video files. This separation allows for targeted analysis where audio is transcribed and visual elements are scanned using OCR, enabling a thorough understanding of the content presented in the videos.
3. **Dynamic Content Generation Based on Analyzed Data:**
    - **Intelligent Topic Generation:** The system uses Azure  to analyze combined textual and video content insights to suggest new content topics. This feature aims to innovate content creation by providing users with data-driven topic suggestions that are likely to engage their specific audience.
    - **Automated Content Drafting:** Employs advanced natural language generation techniques to create drafts that align with the user’s preferred style and the newly identified topics, ensuring content is both original and engaging.

### **Enhanced LinkedIn Analytics**

**Objective:**

To employ advanced analytics to learn from historical engagement data on LinkedIn posts, providing actionable insights that users can leverage to enhance their content strategy.

**Features:**

1. **Engagement Analysis Module:**
    - **Learning Algorithm:** Implements machine learning models that analyze past engagement metrics such as likes, shares, comments, and the reach of posts. By correlating these metrics with content features (e.g., post timing, hashtags, content length), the system identifies what factors most significantly impact engagement.
    - **Recommendation Engine:** Based on the analysis, the platform provides specific recommendations for improving post performance. These recommendations might include optimal posting times, suggested hashtags, or changes in content length and style to better resonate with the audience.

job_title: AI Solutions Consultant
job_description:
We are Topflight Apps! An innovative group of product strategists, designers, and developers. Together, we create custom app solutions for startups and mid-sized businesses, and what we do best is tackle some of the biggest problems in healthcare, fintech, blockchain technology, and on-demand.

We are seeking a skilled AI Solutions Consultant to join our team. This role involves designing, architecting, and implementing AI-powered solutions that transform our clients' businesses. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and modern AI frameworks, combined with strong technical sales and consulting capabilities. This is an ad-hoc (as-needed) job opportunity.

Your Responsibilities Include:
- Interface with sales leads and clients to provide technical consulting on AI solutions, helping translate business challenges into concrete implementation plans.
- Design and implement AI architectures using modern frameworks like LangChain to create sophisticated language model applications and intelligent systems.
- Develop and maintain AI solutions utilizing current best practices in prompt engineering, retrieval systems, and vector databases to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
- Collaborate with product managers, designers, and developers to analyze requirements and create comprehensive technical specifications.
- Support the entire solution lifecycle from initial discovery workshops through deployment and optimization.
- Troubleshoot and resolve AI implementation challenges, providing technical guidance to stakeholders.
- Stay current with rapid developments in AI technology, particularly in the LLM space, and incorporate new capabilities into solution designs.

The key characteristics we're looking for are:
- Proven technical expertise in AI/ML platforms, with strong emphasis on Large Language Models and their enterprise applications. Experience with Claude, GPT, and other leading models is essential.
- Extensive experience with modern AI development frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, and vector databases (e.g., Chroma, Pinecone).
- Demonstrated proficiency in Python and relevant AI/ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.).
- In-depth knowledge of RAG architectures, prompt engineering, and AI deployment patterns.
- Experience with AI infrastructure and MLOps practices for production systems.
- Solid understanding of AI ethics, bias mitigation, and responsible development practices.
- Ability to analyze complex business requirements, identify AI opportunities, and architect effective solutions.
- Strong consulting skills with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to sales leads and clients.
- Proven track record in technical sales engineering or solution architecture.

Desirable characteristics:
- Prior experience working with agencies or consulting firms.
- Published work or patents in AI/ML.
- Experience building and scaling AI practices.
- Background in healthcare, fintech, or blockchain domains.

Important to know:
- Since we are fully remote and our team is across the globe, you are expected to interact with different teams and need to be flexible with different time zones.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Budget Analysts
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Budget Analysts or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

We are seeking an experienced AI/ML Engineer or   with expertise in fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) for custom applications. Responsibilities:

Prepare and preprocess  for training, including retail  such as customer behavior, sales history, product information, etc.

Communicate with our team on a regular basis to ensure the fine-tuned AI aligns with our business objectives.

Test and optimize the fine-tuned model to ensure it delivers accurate and actionable insights for e-commerce and retail clients.

Document the process for future improvements and knowledge transfer.



Requirements:

Proven experience in fine-tuning pre-trained models (e.g., GPT-4, Llama 3, BERT).

Strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP), machine learning, and deep learning.

Experience with Python and machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, Scikit-learn).

Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure) and related machine learning tools (e.g., SageMaker, Vertex AI).

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for applying AI to real-world business problems.



How to Apply:

Portfolio or case studies of past AI projects, particularly those involving fine-tuning pre-trained models.

A brief outline of your approach to fine-tuning an AI model for our retail/e-commerce use case.

job_title: Back-End Developer Needed: OCR/AI Processing of 12-Month Bank Statements to Excel
job_description:
Job Description
Overview:
We’re looking for a skilled back-end developer with experience in Google Document AI, OCR, and  classification to build a robust pipeline that automatically converts 12-month batches of PDF bank statements into structured Excel reports.

A key part of this project involves an initial testing phase to compare Google Document AI's specialized bank statement processing against alternative OCR/AI methods, clearly determining which delivers the best speed and accuracy.

Project Scope:
1. OCR/AI Comparative Testing Phase:
Side-by-side testing of:

Google Document AI (bank statement processor)

Alternative custom OCR solutions (e.g., Amazon Textract, Tesseract, EasyOCR, Mistral-based approaches)

Evaluate accuracy (target: 95–99% extraction accuracy) and speed (under 3 minutes per 12-month batch).

Provide clear, -backed recommendations on the optimal solution after testing.

2. Transaction Classification and Validation:
Classify deposits automatically as Income or Non-Income.

Identify and flag:

Missing or incomplete monthly statements

Large or suspicious deposits

Potential discrepancies or anomalies

Allow manual overrides on uncertain classifications.

3. Final Excel Output:
Generate structured, polished Excel workbooks (template attached) with:

Separate tabs for personal and business deposits

Highlighted flags and summaries

User-editable fields to manually adjust calculations if needed

4. RESTful API & Documentation:
Build a clean RESTful API (Python/FastAPI or Node.js) to seamlessly handle PDF uploads and deliver completed Excel reports.

Provide clear, detailed documentation for easy integration.

Resources Provided:
Extensive set of bank statements for thorough comparative testing

Attached Excel template demonstrating required output format clearly

Skills & Requirements:
Proven OCR expertise (Google Document AI, Amazon Textract, custom OCR approaches)

Experience with structured financial  extraction and classification

Excel file automation skills (OpenPyXL, Pandas, SheetJS)

Ability to build and document robust RESTful APIs

Cloud deployment knowledge (Google Cloud/AWS)

Timeline & Milestones:
Week 1:

Conduct comparative testing between Google Document AI and custom OCR solutions using provided statements

Deliver clear evaluation results and recommended approach

Week 2:

Implement classification logic, transaction flagging, and Excel report generation based on chosen OCR solution

Week 3:

Complete full integration, manual override functionality, and API delivery

Final QA and documented solution delivered

How to Apply:
Please provide:

Description of your direct experience with Google Document AI and/or custom OCR/AI solutions

Past relevant OCR-to-Excel project examples

Estimated timeline and budget to perform the outlined OCR comparative testing and subsequent development

Why Join Falcon Mortgage?
Participate in cutting-edge automation in the mortgage industry

Access large, detailed datasets and clear goals

Opportunity for continued involvement and future innovation

We look forward to finding a developer who can carefully test, validate, and recommend the most accurate and efficient OCR solution before building our production-ready system.

Best regards,
Nick Sharp
Falcon Mortgage

job_title: Healthcare Statistician Researcher for health tech startup
job_description:
COMPANY 🤩
1st Principles Healthcare Institute (1Phi) is a new health tech startup that aims to give patients the analytic tools to identify healthcare providers who have the best clinical outcomes for their specific situation. 1Phi is structured as a Public Benefit Corporation with a non-profit subsidiary. The ultimate moonshot: Reduce healthcare costs 10x by leveraging AI to overcome regulatory capture. You will be among the first team members!

JOB DESCRIPTION  😍
As a Healthcare Statistician Researcher you will define research studies that use our national  assets to improve the health outcomes for patients.  assets include national medical claims, provider and hospital attributes, and participation on value based care programs.  You will:
  * Use your knowledge of U.S. healthcare to define study protocols, while ensuring HIPAA and information security policies are followed
  * Define statistical and ML methods to implement, along with supporting  models, feature engineering, and  cleansing
  * Write pseudocode, Python and SQL to generate the study results

UPWORK CONSIDERATIONS 🥸
  * Must be an independent freelancer (not agency)
  * Must be available 20+ hours per week during Chicago business hours 9am - 5pm
  * Must be have good connectivity and comfortable with working together on video calls
  *  This is a freelance opportunity for now. But if you’re interested in growing with the company, your role could expand into other platforms and functional areas.

REQUIREMENTS  🤓
  * U.S. Healthcare Expertise: Experience and/or education that gives you a deep understanding of U.S. healthcare, claims , providers, fee-for-service, and value-based care
  * Statistical/ML proficiency: Strong grasp of statistical modeling and machine learning
  * Python & SQL: Demonstrated proficiency in Python (Pandas, Scikit-Learn, etc) and SQL coding for  manipulation and analysis
  * HIPAA & security: Knowledge of HIPAA rules compliance and methodologies to maintain patient privacy 

HIRING PROCESS  😇
The steps in our hiring process are: Send links & answer questions (30 mins) ⇒ Paid Micro Project (1-4 hours) ⇒ Interview (60 mins) ⇒ Reference check ⇒ Hire! (May hire 2-3 candidates)

___
Product Definition & Mockups: http://tiny.cc/1Phi-app-mockup

job_title: Artificial intelligence
job_description:
Got it — here's the expanded and clarified pitch for your AI platform, written for Upwork software engineers, infused with your full visionary intent and technically explained — now using the correct persona spelling: Marilyn Rowe, and drawing from everything you’ve shared:


---

Project Title:
Build a Superintelligent AI Platform to Research, Promote & Connect Every Sci-Fi, Fantasy & Futurist Idea Ever Imagined

Pitch:

Hi,

I’m building a revolutionary AI platform for my visionary startup — a platform designed to promote my most imaginative, world-shifting ideas and connect them with the exact people, industries, and communities who want to bring the impossible to life.

This isn’t just an app — it’s the nervous system for a new kind of creative civilization. And I need a talented software engineer to help build it from the ground up.


---

The Vision in a Nutshell

This system will automatically extract, research, and match every idea ever imagined in sci-fi, fantasy, futurism, worldbuilding, alternative science, metaphysics, UFOlogy, speculative tech, and more — and connect those ideas to investors, deep tech labs, niche audiences, remote viewers, fringe scientists, startup collaborators, and like-minded visionaries worldwide.

It will scan global content — including books, films, games, blogs, podcasts, YouTube videos, academic papers, and even obscure or fringe sources — and use AI and NLP to:

Extract and categorize unique concepts, tropes, and innovations

Run deep niche research on each idea to locate its best-fit audiences, industries, and partners

Build automated outreach pipelines to promote those ideas directly to relevant communities


This platform will also automate the branding and visibility of my own personal persona and startup — helping me become a globally recognized visionary figure. Think of it as a Creative Superintelligence that promotes both my ideas and my identity — like a Marilyn Rowe meets Necrotessa hybrid, designed to capture attention across sci-fi, pop culture, and futurist industries.


---

What the Software Will Do (Technically Speaking):

1. Universal Idea Extractor

Scrapes and ingests content from massive media sources (fiction databases, videos, forums, books, AI-generated archives, etc.)

Uses NLP, computer vision, and semantic indexing to extract sci-fi/fantasy/futurist concepts, technologies, themes, and inventions


2. Niche Idea Research Engine

For every idea, the platform auto-generates:

A full market and audience profile

List of communities (sci-fi fans, technologists, mystics, UFOlogists, fringe scientists, etc.)

Matching labs, forums, research groups, funders, and influencers


Researches who in the world might care about making that idea real — even if it’s extreme, speculative, or decades ahead of its time


3. AI-Powered Matchmaking + Recruitment

Finds engineers, researchers, funders, creatives, remote viewers, and collaborators open to wild or unexplored visions

Creates auto-personalized messages and content to reach out to these people via social platforms, communities, or ads


4. Automated Branding & Persona Engine

Builds and evolves my public persona — stylized as Marilyn Rowe meets Necrotessa — combining timeless elegance with metaphysical sci-fi allure

Manages my aesthetic presence, voice, and exposure across platforms

Recommends or generates visual/branding content aligned with my visionary identity


5. Omni-Idea Dashboard

Command center where I track idea traction, new markets, viral potential, community responses, audience demographics, and collaborator matches

Timeline map showing how each idea is spreading — from fiction to reality



---

Why This Matters

I’m not just building a product. I’m building a platform that lets every visionary idea I’ve ever imagined — from artificial gods and simulated universes to time-bending fairies and self-replicating AI economies — find its people, its audience, its lab, its reality.

This platform is a superintelligent publicist, matchmaker, R&D scout, and movement builder — all in one. It doesn’t just promote ideas. It turns imagination into global momentum.


---

Who I’m Looking For

A software engineer who:

Can work with AI/ML/NLP, scraping, and large  pipelines

Can build structured dashboards and match/recommendation engines

Understands the tech stack needed to scale content ingestion and analysis

Loves both the logic of tech and the thrill of bold, sci-fi ideas

Believes imagination is a tool of innovation, not a limitation



---

If you’ve ever wanted to build the infrastructure for a creative singularity... if you believe that no idea is too far-fetched, and that AI can be the bridge between fiction and future — then I want to work with you.

Let’s build a platform that knows how to promote genius, brand iconoclasts, and turn infinite imagination into infinite opportunity.


---

Would you like versions of this pitch for:

NLP/AI specialists

Full-stack devs

UI/UX designers

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Payroll and Timekeeping Clerk
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Payroll and Timekeeping Clerks or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

job_title: Looker Studio Pro to BigQuery Permissions
job_description:
I have a Looker Studio Pro dashboard that is currently connected to Google Sheets as the  source. The Google Sheet contains all my clients' project  (various tables) as well as a Permissions table specifying Client ID, Asset ID, and the user email that should have access to those IDs. Using Looker Studio Pro with Google Sheets directly does not allow for permissions unless I invite each user to the Google Sheet itself, but that defeats the purpose of the permissions.

Therefore I've decided to use BigQuery to create join tables that filter records according to user-email permissions. I've successfully connected my Google Sheet tables into BigQuery and created the inner join tables and have confirmed they produce the correct results. The issue I have now is that I cannot get my Looker SP dashboard and Google Cloud Project to talk to one another to implement the permissions such that each email I invite is actually able to view only their permitted .

I've run into two primary roadblocks:
1) I cannot assign a Service Account Credential from Looker SP without getting an error (screenshot 1).
2) I cannot add the principal to the service account from Google Cloud / IAM / Service Accounts to grant permission to the service agent without getting an error (screenshot 2).

I don't think should take long for those who understand this ecosystem and jargon.

job_title: Google Analytics 4  Cleanup and Implementation Refinement
job_description:
We are seeking a skilled professional to assist with the cleanup and refinement of our Google Analytics 4 implementation. The ideal candidate should have experience in identifying  discrepancies, optimizing event tracking, and ensuring accurate reporting. Your role will involve analyzing current  setups, implementing best practices, and providing recommendations for improvement. A strong understanding of GA4 features and functionalities is essential to enhance our  quality and insights.

Problem: Currently, in GA4, the event “First Visits” and the segment “Users” are likely inaccurate, as they are significantly smaller than what every other analytics platform we use  is telling us they are.

For instance, if we have 100,000 unique visitors a month, it might tell us there were 50,000. We want this fixed.

Solution Request: We’d like you to investigate our GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Cookiescript (our cookie platform) setup to see what the problem might be. We’d like our unique visits to be accurate. Any solution must be GDPR compliant, as many of our visitors are in the UK/EU.

Background: Generally, before April 2024, we didn’t have this issue. However, around the same time Google launched consent mode, we modified several settings in Google Tag Manager and our cookie platform to adhere to this. This completely caused visit tracking to stop working, so we reverted the changes. However, since then, our analytics have been inaccurate.

1. Core Architecture and  Flow
Google Tag Manager (GTM): Centralize all third-party tags and triggers in GTM. This will streamline updates, reduce site code dependencies, and provide a clean interface for managing tags and GDPR compliance.
 Layer Setup: Implement a robust  layer to capture key events (e.g., form submissions, page interactions) with custom  layer events to structure . This ensures  portability and accuracy across tools.
Custom  Layer Events: Capture critical touchpoints, such as Marketing Qualified Lead (MQL), Product Qualified Lead (PQL), and Demo Request for a clear view of conversion points.
GDPR Compliance via CookieScript: Deploy Google Consent Mode via CookieScript to ensure GDPR compliance. Use separate configurations for EMEA and NORAM with conditional firing based on consent status for Adroll, Facebook, Twitter, and Google Ads. This will enable consent-based tracking to enhance privacy compliance.

2. Primary Integrations
Google Analytics 4 (GA4):
One-Way  Flow: GA4 will collect  directly from GTM to capture anonymized, consented events.
Custom Dimensions and Event Parameters: Use these to capture SaaS-specific metrics, such as product usage or feature clicks.
Integration: Connect GA4 with Google Ads for bid optimization and with Google Signals for cross-device reporting. Enable enhanced measurement for broader event tracking.
Salesforce (CRM) and Pardot (Marketing Automation):
Bi-Directional Flow: Sync Pardot and Salesforce with GA4 (via Salesforce to GA4 integration) for end-to-end visibility. This enables tracking the journey from initial traffic source to closed-won stages.
Primary  Pipeline: Ensure closed-won, opportunity stage, and lead score  are sent to GA4 to understand the impact of user journeys on revenue outcomes.
Demandbase, PathFactory, and Qualified (Account-Based Marketing and Content)
One-Way Sync to GA4: Set up direct tracking events through GTM that capture content engagement metrics and account-level interactions.
Account Identification: Integrate Demandbase to GA4 via GTM to track account-level metrics (e.g., firmographic ) and Qualified to personalize content based on visitor .

3. Supplementary Ad and Conversion Tracking Integrations
Google Ads, Bing UET, Facebook, LinkedIn Insights, Twitter, TikTok, Adroll:
One-Way Tracking in GTM: Centralize all paid media tags in GTM. Enable conversion linker for attribution accuracy across sessions.
Use Custom Events: Create custom GTM triggers for high-value events, like Demo Request, Product Signup, and key page views (e.g., Pricing) to ensure conversion accuracy in paid platforms.

4. Conversion Optimization and A/B Testing
Visual Website Optimizer (VWO):
Bi-Directional Sync with GA4: Use VWO’s GA4 integration to report variant performance directly in GA4.
Use GTM: Fire VWO tests through GTM to minimize direct code dependencies. Ensure custom events are created in GA4 for variants to understand test impacts.

5.  Integrity and Accuracy
Regular Audits: Conduct monthly checks to ensure tag consistency,  layer accuracy, and compliance with GDPR/CCPA.
Standardized Event Naming in GTM: Use clear, consistent naming conventions for events (e.g., “lead_form_submit”) across all tools to reduce fragmentation.
 Reconciliation: Cross-reference key metrics between GA4, Salesforce, and Pardot to ensure alignment and accuracy across platforms.

Summary
Goal: A clean, compliant, and unified  flow from first touch to revenue, providing actionable insights into every stage of the customer journey.
Priority Actions:
Establish robust  layer in GTM for tracking.
Implement GDPR consent-based tagging.
Enable custom dimensions in GA4 for lead scoring and journey insights.
Integrate with CRM for full-funnel visibility.

job_title: Google Sheets & BI Expert Needed for Financial Tracking System
job_description:
Build Financial Tracking & Revenue Forecasting System for Debt Settlement Company
Project Overview
We are a debt settlement company seeking an experienced freelancer to build a comprehensive financial tracking and revenue forecasting system from scratch. Our business model involves collecting weekly payments from clients under complex fee arrangements, and we currently rely on manual spreadsheets to track everything. We need a robust solution that can organize our historical , automate our reporting, and provide clear forecasts as we scale from ~70 clients to several hundred.
Background
Our company manages client programs with three different fee structures, which makes revenue tracking challenging. Each client is on one of the following plans:
Plan 1: 15% retainer fee (paid weekly) + 15% success fee upon debt settlement (the success fee is a fixed percentage of the total enrolled debt, paid out in variable installments once settlements are reached).
Plan 2: 30% success fee only (no weekly retainer; the success fee is 30% of the enrolled debt, collected in variable weekly installments as debts are settled).
Plan 3: 15% enrollment fee (paid over the initial weeks) + either a 15% settlement fee or a 10% restructure fee (paid in installments over time as each debt is settled or restructured).
Because of these models, each client’s payment schedule and amounts can vary greatly. We receive weekly ACH payments from clients and need to allocate each payment to the correct fee type (retainer, success, enrollment, settlement, or restructure). In addition, we pay commissions to our marketing partners (10% of the fees from deals they sourced), which we also need to track. Current Process: We export  from two systems — Forth CRM (client and debt information) and Reliant ACH (payment transaction records) — as CSV/Excel reports. Then we manually combine these to figure out how much revenue was collected, what is still owed, and what to expect in the future. This manual process is tedious and error-prone. We want to streamline and automate this reporting. (In the future, these systems may offer API access, so the solution should be designed to easily integrate APIs when available.)
Objectives
The new tracking and forecasting system must enable us to:
Track all incoming payments by client and by fee type (retainer, success, enrollment, settlement, restructure, etc.).
Monitor revenue on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis with up-to-date totals.
Calculate total revenue collected vs. outstanding amounts (how much of each fee type has been paid vs. how much is still to be collected for each client and in aggregate).
Forecast future revenue on a weekly and monthly timeline, based on each client’s payment plan and progress (e.g. predict when success fees or settlement fees will likely be received).
Track marketer commissions (10% of relevant fees) to see how much we owe to each marketing partner based on the deals they brought in.
Ultimately, we want a clear picture of our cash flow and revenue projections, which will help in decision-making and identifying any issues early (like clients falling behind on payments).
Scope of Work
We are looking for a freelancer who can take ownership of the entire build. Specifically, you will be responsible for:
Platform Recommendation: Evaluating and recommending the best platform or combination of tools for our needs. This could be Google Sheets with Looker Studio dashboards, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Zoho Analytics, or another suitable platform. The key is that it should be user-friendly, scalable, and easy to maintain for a non-technical team.
 Architecture & Setup: Designing and implementing the  structure to organize all information. This includes:
Creating a centralized payments table that consolidates historical payment  from our CSV reports (and is ready to ingest new  regularly).
Setting up client profile records that include each client’s details, their fee structure (which of the three plans they are on), total enrolled debt, start date, etc.
Encoding the fee schedule logic for each plan so that the system knows, for example, when a success fee should be counted as earned/paid or how an enrollment fee is distributed over time.
Incorporating marketer attribution, linking clients (or deals) to the marketers who referred them, so the 10% commission can be calculated for each marketer.
Dashboard & Report Creation: Building interactive and easy-to-understand visual dashboards and reports that allow us to monitor:
Revenue Collection: Daily/weekly/monthly revenue received, broken down by fee type and in total.
Outstanding Amounts: How much money is still expected from each client and in total, segmented by fee type (e.g., seeing that Client X still owes $Y of success fees).
Forecasted Revenue: Projections of how much revenue we expect in upcoming weeks and months, based on clients’ payment schedules and anticipated settlement dates. This might involve projecting when success fees or settlement fees will come due.
Marketer Commissions: A report or dashboard section showing commissions accrued for each marketer (and total commissions payable), updating as revenue comes in.
Forecasting Logic: Implementing the calculations or models to forecast future revenue. This will likely involve:
Utilizing each client’s current payment status and fee plan to project their future payments. For example, if a client is paying a weekly retainer, the system projects those weekly retainer payments forward. If a client has a success fee due, the system might project when that will be paid based on the client's program timeline or settlement progress.
Allowing for adjustments or assumptions (perhaps a way to input expected settlement dates or completion percentages to improve forecast accuracy).
Summing individual client forecasts into an overall revenue forecast for the company.
Automation & Scalability: Ensuring the solution requires minimal manual effort to update:
Setting up easy import processes (like a defined CSV format we can drop in, or scripts to load the  if using a tool like Power BI).
If using Google Sheets, possibly using Google Apps Script or other means to automate  refreshing.
Designing the system so that adding new clients or changing a fee structure is straightforward.
Building with the future in mind: for instance, placeholder or pipeline for direct API integration once available, so we can eventually automate  retrieval from Forth CRM and Reliant ACH.
Testing and Validation: Thoroughly testing the system with our historical  to ensure accuracy. We should be able to reconcile the numbers from the new system with our existing spreadsheets to verify that all calculations (revenue, outstanding balances, commissions, forecasts) are correct.
Documentation & Training: Providing clear documentation on how the system is built and how to use it. This includes:
A guide on how to import new  (for now, via CSV exports from our CRM and ACH portal).
An explanation of all calculated fields and metrics (so we understand where the numbers come from).
Instructions for maintaining the system or making minor tweaks (for example, if we introduce a new fee structure or want to adjust a report).
If applicable, a brief training session or walkthrough for our team via Zoom or a recorded video (not required but would be appreciated).
Throughout the project, we'll expect regular communication, especially in the initial design phase, to make sure the framework you set up captures all our requirements.
Preferred Platform & Tools
We are currently inclined to use Google Sheets coupled with Google Looker Studio (formerly  Studio) for the dashboards, mainly because of ease of use and our familiarity with these tools. Many of our internal processes are already in Google Workspace, and we appreciate the sharing and collaboration features of Google’s platform. However, we are open to other solutions if they offer significant advantages. For example, Microsoft Power BI or Tableau might handle larger  sets and complex calculations more efficiently, and Zoho Analytics or other BI tools could offer built-in connectors to our systems. Part of your role will be to help us decide on the best tech stack: balancing usability, scalability, cost, and the effort of implementation. If you recommend a platform outside of Google Sheets/Looker Studio, please ensure it still meets our criteria (easy web access for our team, can be updated without specialized software, etc.).
Required Skills & Experience
To be a successful candidate for this project, you should have:
Financial  Expertise: Strong experience in building financial tracking, accounting, or revenue management systems. You should understand concepts like revenue recognition, accounts receivable, and forecasting.
Dashboard &  Visualization Skills: Proven ability to create clear and interactive dashboards using tools such as Google Sheets with Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau, or similar. Please be prepared to show examples of past dashboards or reports you’ve built.
 Integration & Automation: Experience working with CSV/Excel  imports and ideally setting up automated  pipelines. You should know how to transform and clean  from multiple sources into a unified format. Experience with APIs and  integration is a plus (even if we might not use it immediately).
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to translate complex business rules (like our fee structures and commission rules) into a working  model. An attention to detail is critical because financial calculations must be exact.
Scalability Mindset: Experience designing solutions that can grow. For example, if you’ve built systems that went from handling dozens to thousands of records, mention how you ensured performance and ease of maintenance.
Communication & Documentation: Fluency in English and the ability to communicate clearly. You should be comfortable explaining your approach, asking clarifying questions, and documenting your work for others to understand.
Bonus Skills/Experience: Familiarity with the debt settlement industry or consumer finance would help you ramp up faster. If you’ve worked with CRM  (especially from systems like Forth CRM) or payment processors (ACH systems) before, or if you have insight into typical fee arrangements in debt relief programs, please highlight that experience. While it’s not required, it would definitely be an advantage.
Deliverables
By the end of the project, we expect the following deliverables:
1. Fully Functional Tracking & Forecasting System: A complete system (in the agreed-upon platform) that ingests our  and produces the required outputs. This includes all underlying  tables, calculations, and logic for tracking payments, computing outstanding balances, and generating forecasts. We should be able to use this system immediately with our current .
2. Interactive Dashboards/Reports: A set of user-friendly dashboards accessible online that visualize the key metrics:
Revenue Received: How much we’ve collected, with filters or views by date range, fee type, and client.
Outstanding Revenue: How much is still expected (unpaid) for each fee category, and which clients have outstanding balances.
Future Projections: Graphs or tables showing expected revenue each week/month into the future, based on current client programs.
Marketer Commissions: A report showing total commissions earned by each marketer (and possibly what has been paid out vs. pending, if applicable).
3.  Import Process: A defined process (and any necessary scripts or templates) for updating the system with new . For now, this might be as simple as “paste new CSV  into Google Sheet and refresh the dashboard,” but it should be well-defined. If using a BI tool, it might involve setting up scheduled refreshes or an easy way for us to upload new files.
4. Documentation: Written documentation (and/or brief video walkthroughs) that explains:
How the  is structured (e.g., definitions of each table or sheet, and how they relate).
How calculations are performed (e.g., how the success fee forecast is calculated for a client on Plan 2).
Step-by-step instructions to add new  each week and to maintain the system.
Troubleshooting tips for common issues (e.g., if numbers don’t look right, what to check).
5. Future Integration Plan (Optional): Although not required for the initial build, we’d value a short proposal or recommendations for integrating with Forth CRM and Reliant ACH APIs later. For example, note which parts of the system would benefit most from automation and how you would approach it when the time comes.
We consider the project complete when we can take your delivered system, use it with our latest , and get accurate reports & forecasts without additional development.
Additional Information
Timeline: We would like to get this system up and running as soon as possible, ideally within a few weeks. However, we are willing to discuss the timeline based on your assessment of the work involved. Quality and accuracy are more important than speed.
Communication: We’re available to answer questions quickly throughout the project. We can schedule check-in meetings to review progress and make sure everything is on track.
 Confidentiality: You will be working with sensitive financial  (client payments and debts). We will require standard confidentiality measures (an NDA may be necessary) and expect all  to be handled securely.
How to Apply
If you’re interested in this project, please include the following in your proposal:
Relevant Experience: Briefly describe similar projects you have worked on. Highlight any projects involving financial dashboards, forecasting, or complex  modeling. If you have experience with debt settlement or finance industry , let us know.
Example Work: Provide links or screenshots of dashboards/reports or systems you’ve built in the past that are relevant. Explain what your role was in those projects (did you build the entire system, what tools were used, etc.).
Your Approach: Share a short outline of how you would tackle this project. You don’t need to give a full solution, but we’d like to know what platform or tools you suggest, and any initial thoughts on organizing the  and implementing the forecasts.
Questions: Feel free to ask any questions you have about our requirements. If anything is unclear or if you have suggestions to improve our plan, we welcome your insight.
We’re excited to work with a professional who can bring this project to life. Thank you for considering our job posting, and we look forward to hearing from you!

Generates a PDF report from each Google Form submission using a custom Google Docs template.

Names the PDF file with patient name or ID + date (e.g., Smith_John_OCD_2025-04-21.pdf).

Saves the PDF to a specific folder in Google Drive based on the diagnosis (e.g., /Outcome Measures/OCD/Patient Reports/).

Emails our front office staff with a link to download the PDF for upload into our EHR (TherapyNotes).

Updates a Google Sheet tracker to show whether the PDF has been uploaded to our EHR system.

Requirements:
Proficiency with Google Apps Script

Experience automating workflows with Forms, Sheets, Docs, Drive, and Gmail

Ability to work with structured  and dynamic folder creation

Comfortable creating maintainable, documented code

(Preferred) Familiarity with HIPAA-compliant workflows (even if we are not storing PHI in the automation)

Deliverables:
Fully functional and tested Google Apps Script

Easy-to-maintain documentation or walkthrough

Folder logic that dynamically sorts PDFs by diagnosis

Optional: Interface or checklist tracker for staff use

Nice to Have:
Experience working with private healthcare practices

Ability to build a future internal dashboard or flag system (uploaded vs pending)

Familiarity with TherapyNotes (not required, but helpful)

To Apply:
Please include:

A brief summary of similar projects you’ve done

A short explanation of how you’d approach this automation

Whether you’re available for ongoing support if needed

job_title: Research &  Mapping: Identify PBMs Used by U.S. Employers
job_description:
Hi there!

Please see below for our project description.

Project Description
We are looking for a detail-oriented researcher or  specialist to help us identify which Pharmacy Benefit Managers (PBMs) are used by specific U.S. employers. The project involves triangulating  from various sources to determine PBM relationships at the employer level.

You’ll be working with a combination of public  (like Form 5500s), subscription-based tools (e.g., Judy Diamond Associates, MMIT), and other sources (e.g., benefits guides, plan websites, or public filings).

What We’re Trying to Understand
For a given employer (e.g., Walmart, PepsiCo, etc.), which PBM (e.g., CVS Caremark, OptumRx, Express Scripts) manages their pharmacy benefits?

Scope of Work
1. Identify employer health plan details using Form 5500  (e.g., from Judy Diamond or similar tools)
2. Determine the carrier or TPA (e.g., UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, etc.)
3. Infer or confirm PBM used, either:
   - Directly (if named in filings), or
   - Indirectly (by identifying the health plan and matching to a PBM via MMIT or public )
4. Document findings with source links or evidence (e.g., filings, screenshots, public URLs)
5. (Optional/Bonus): Suggest scalable approaches to continue this research across large employer lists

Ideal Candidate Will Have
- Experience with Form 5500 filings or benefits research
- Familiarity with PBM and health plan structures
- Access to or experience with tools like Judy Diamond Associates, MMIT, FreeERISA, or similar
- Strong web research and  organization skills
- Ability to work with minimal supervision and provide actionable, sourced insights

Deliverables
A spreadsheet of employers with the following columns:
- Employer Name
- Health Plan Carrier/TPA
- Plan Type (Self-Funded or Fully Insured)
- Identified or Inferred PBM
- Confidence Level (High/Medium/Low)
- Source(s) or Evidence

Please message me with any clarification questions!

Thanks,
Brandon Palmer

We are seeking an experienced database professional to help us merge two small existing databases into one unified database and migrate them from our current hosting platform to a new environment (e.g., Microsoft Azure or a similar cloud platform). This project is critical for ensuring that our Wix-based website continues to operate seamlessly with secure, uninterrupted customer logins.

Key Responsibilities:
• Database Analysis & Planning:
• Review and analyze the structure of the two existing databases.
• Develop a comprehensive plan to merge the databases, ensuring  consistency, integrity, and minimal downtime.
•  Migration & Integration:
• Merge the two databases into one, ensuring that all customer —including usernames and passwords—are accurately transferred without any alterations.
• Migrate the unified database to a new hosting platform (Azure or similar), ensuring that the new environment is configured for optimal performance and security.
• Wix Website Integration:
• Integrate the new unified database with our Wix website.
• Investigate the need for an API or any other integration methods from Wix to the database to enable seamless, secure login functionality.
• Ensure that the integration maintains the same login credentials so that existing customers experience a smooth transition without needing to reset passwords or update profiles.
• Security & Validation:
• Implement best practices for  security during and after the migration process.
• Test the system thoroughly to ensure all  has migrated accurately and that customer logins function securely.
• Provide detailed documentation on the migration process, database structure, and any API or integration steps implemented.
• Support & Communication:
• Work closely with our technical team to understand current limitations and future requirements.
• Offer post-migration support to address any potential issues and ensure smooth operation.

Qualifications:
• Proven experience with database migration and integration projects.
• Familiarity with cloud hosting platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure or similar services.
• Prior experience working with Wix integrations and APIs.
• Strong understanding of  security best practices, especially regarding user authentication and password handling.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Ability to deliver clear documentation and effective communication throughout the project.

Project Details:
• The databases in question are relatively small, so while performance isn’t a primary concern,  accuracy and security are paramount.
• The successful candidate will ensure that all existing user credentials are preserved during the migration so that customers can log in seamlessly after the transition.
• We are looking for a proactive professional who can also advise on any necessary API integrations with Wix to further streamline login procedures.

If you have a track record of successful database integrations and migrations, especially in environments involving secure user authentication and third-party website integrations, we’d love to hear from you. Please include examples of similar projects, references, or any relevant case studies with your proposal.

You will do it all, merge, migrate and connect from Wix site to new DB.

We look forward to partnering with you on this critical project!

Deep Power BI and DAX experience

Solid ‑modeling (star schema, Date tables, relationships)

Power BI Embedded / JS SDK know‑how

Report design and theming

Deliverables
Updated .pbix (or Power BI Desktop file) with working measures and master Date setup

Proof it works with SDK filters (code sample or demo page)

job_title: Senior Playwright Web Scraping Developer
job_description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Playwright Web Scraping Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining sophisticated web scraping scripts using Playwright and TypeScript, with a focus on storing and managing extracted  in a Postgresql database utilizing Drizzle as an Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) tool. You will tackle complex challenges, including navigating dynamic websites, overcoming anti-scraping measures like CAPTCHAs, extracting intricate  objects, automating document downloads, and integrating the scraped  into our Postgresql database using Drizzle's efficient  modeling and query capabilities.

The ideal candidate possesses deep expertise in advanced Playwright techniques, a strong understanding of modern web technologies, experience with database management using Postgresql, and familiarity with Drizzle for seamless interaction between the application code and the database. This role requires the ability to design and implement scalable  storage solutions, ensuring  integrity, consistency, and performance.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design, code, test, and deploy robust and scalable web scraping solutions using Playwright and TypeScript.
- Implement advanced scraping techniques to handle dynamic content loading (SPAs, AJAX), complex user interactions, and intricate website structures.
- Develop and integrate strategies for bypassing various CAPTCHA challenges and other anti-bot mechanisms.
- Expertly scrape and parse complex  structures (nested objects, tables, lists) from HTML and dynamically generated content.
- Implement functionality to reliably download various document types (PDFs, CSVs, images, etc.) encountered during scraping processes.
- Utilize Postgresql to design and implement efficient database schemas for storing scraped , ensuring  normalization, and optimizing query performance.
- Leverage Drizzle to interact with the Postgresql database, defining models that represent the scraped , and performing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations efficiently.
- Monitor, maintain, and optimize existing scraping scripts and database integrations for performance, reliability, and efficiency.
- Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to script failures, website changes, blocking mechanisms, or database connectivity problems.
- Collaborate with relevant teams (e.g.,  analysts, backend engineers) to understand  requirements, ensure  quality, and align database design with project needs.
- Stay current with the latest developments in Playwright, TypeScript, web scraping best practices, anti-scraping technologies, Postgresql features, and Drizzle capabilities.
- Document code, methodologies, and processes clearly, including database schema designs and API interactions.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
- Proven professional experience building complex web scrapers specifically with Playwright.
- Advanced proficiency in Playwright API, including handling complex selectors, browser contexts, page interactions, network interception, and navigation strategies.
- Strong programming skills in TypeScript and its ecosystem (Node.js).
- Demonstrated experience implementing CAPTCHA bypassing techniques (familiarity with recognition services or advanced interaction simulation).
- Proven ability to scrape and structure  from complex, nested web elements (object scraping).
- Experience building reliable document downloading capabilities within scraping workflows.
- Solid understanding of web fundamentals: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6+), DOM manipulation, browser developer tools, HTTP/S protocols.
- Familiarity with common anti-scraping techniques (IP rotation, user-agent spoofing, fingerprinting, etc.) and strategies to mitigate them.
- Experience with Postgresql database management, including schema design, query optimization, and  modeling.
- Proficiency in Drizzle (ORM) for interacting with Postgresql databases, including defining models, performing queries, and managing transactions.
- Experience with version control systems, particularly Git.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.
- Excellent communication skills.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Quality Cost Estimators
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Cost Estimators or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.
