job_title: Gather website addresses for one individual Parcel record per US County
job_description:
Entry task that requires some thinking and navigating government sites.

Document: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17qKoJ3KG_Z-D_zSxk2Iydvo4QGayMueimlEbADKqdxw/edit#gid=2077306281

Instructions:
1	For each county in the US, we need the URL for the PARCEL SEARCH PAGE for that County's Assessor or Auditor site and example URL that links directly to an INDIVIDUAL PARCEL RECORD in that jurisdictions' parcel search website.
2	We also need a formatted URL, and a value for TYPE which describes whether the formatted URL uses the parcel number (with dashes and periods) or the parcel number standardized value (without dashes and periods).
3	We have provided an example parcel for many of counties that you can try
4	You may not find any results searching by our provided example parcel. If the example parcel doesnt work, try searching by other methods on that county's site, like last name = "smith" or first name = "tom"
5	If you navigate to an individual parcel record and the parcel number is not visible in the URL, paste the URL for the PARCEL SEARCH PAGE for that jurisdiction in column and select "PARCEL SEARCH PAGE ONLY" from the TYPE dropdown
6	The Google link is a quick shortcut to help you get to the government sponsored parcel search site.  Usually that of an assessor, auditor. Only government sites are acceptable
7	When creating a formatted URL example (COLUMN L), put XXX in the URL where the parcel number was
8	If the URL required a standardized version of the parcel number, select that from the TYPE drop down.  If the URL uses a different number that isnt the parcel number - make a note in the comments

Description of fields:
Parcel Search Page - this page should be the page you enter in name/parcel details and hit the search button to get results
Example URL	- this page is an example url linking directly to an individual parcel record
Formatted URL - this url is taken from the example URL and XXX is entered where the parcel number previously was
Type - one of 3 values
Comment - any comments you have on the record

The winner of this bid will review these instructions and submit a few records as examples to demonstrate that they understand the instructions. 

Template cover letters and spam will be ignored.

job_title: Scientist
job_description:
This project aims to build and deploy an advanced AI model that forecasts weekly and monthly case intake volumes at a law firm, while also delivering detailed attribution insights into historical trends across the previous week, previous month, and year-to-date (YTD). The model will combine structured firm  with AI-driven pattern recognition to identify the most influential drivers of case intake, enabling enhanced operational efficiency, staffing decisions, and strategic planning.

Objectives
Predict case intake at weekly and monthly intervals, improving resource planning and marketing timing.

Generate attribution analyses that explain fluctuations in intake volume for the prior week, month, and YTD — broken down by case type, referral source, marketing channel, and geography.

Leverage modern AI techniques to identify nonlinear trends, behavioral signals, and external correlations not obvious through traditional analytics.

Deploy results through an interactive dashboard, providing operations and leadership with real-time insights.

Key Deliverables
AI Forecast Engine: A model trained on historical intake  capable of weekly/monthly prediction.

Attribution Module: A sub-system that explains observed intake changes in recent time periods (prior week/month/YTD).

Interactive Dashboard: User-facing interface for exploring forecasts, attribution, and historical .

 Pipeline: Automated ingestion and transformation of structured and unstructured .

Model Explainability Framework: Tools for interpreting predictions, such as feature importance or local interpretability.

job_title: AI-Powered Construction Lead Scraper – Web Automation Expert

⸻

🛠 Project Overview:

Perera Construction, a leading general contractor in Southern California, is seeking a freelance or contract-based AI engineer / web scraping specialist to build an autonomous lead generation agent.

⸻

🔍 Objective:

Design and implement a system that:
	•	Scrapes  from targeted sources
	•	Monitors RSS feeds and city websites
	•	Extracts and filters leads using market-specific construction keywords and location logic (e.g., “hospital expansion + California”)
	•	Feeds qualified leads into our CRM (HubSpot) with basic enrichment (e.g., company name, project type, location, URL)

🧩 Key Responsibilities:

	•	Integrate with news aggregators (e.g. Inoreader, Feedly) and APIs (where available)
	•	Set up keyword-based filtering with NLP logic for accuracy and relevancy
	•	Build  pipelines to feed qualified leads into HubSpot CRM (via API or automation)
	•	Optional: Deploy and host this as a cloud-based bot, ideally with a low-maintenance GUI dashboard
	•	Recommend and implement scalable architecture for source expansion over time

⸻

💡 Ideal Experience:
	•	Proven experience in web scraping, automation, or search agents
	•	Experience with Scrapy, Selenium, Playwright, or Octoparse API
	•	Knowledge of RSS parsing (e.g., feedparser)
	•	CRM integration experience (HubSpot preferred)
	•	Familiarity with construction industry  a plus
	•	Ability to build autonomous, self-healing agents that run on schedule

⸻

✅ Deliverables:
	•	Working scraper agent with keyword + region logic
	•	Feed management for 50–100 news/RSS sources
	•	Export to CSV and direct push to HubSpot
	•	Documentation + (optional) Docker/container setup

⸻

📍 Work Style:

job_title: Deploy ML Model on AWS with Time Series CSV Training & Inference Pipeline
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
Project Overview:
I’m looking for an experienced AWS + Machine Learning + DevOps engineer to build a fully automated ML pipeline on AWS. The project involves loading a machine learning model (of my choice), training it on time series CSV , running inference via API, and automating infrastructure provisioning using Terraform.

Project Goals:
Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC):

Create a Terraform script to deploy all resources needed for the ML pipeline.

Support terraform apply to spin up the full pipeline and terraform destroy to tear it down.

Model Hosting:

Set up an environment using AWS (SageMaker, S3, Lambda, EC2, or appropriate combo).

Load a user-specified ML model (PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.).

 Pipeline:

Accept time series  via CSV uploads to S3.

Trigger training pipeline automatically or via API/CLI.

Model Training:

Set up a training job (SageMaker preferred) using the uploaded CSV files.

Enable model re-training and versioning.

Inference Endpoint:

Provide a secure endpoint (API Gateway + Lambda or SageMaker endpoint) for inference on new  inputs.

Return predictions in a clean format (e.g., JSON).

Deliverables:
Terraform scripts that can:

Provision all AWS resources

Configure access roles and policies

Destroy the environment cleanly

End-to-end ML pipeline:

Model deployment

Training trigger with CSV upload

Inference via REST API

Documentation covering:

How to use Terraform scripts

job_title: AI Automation Freelancer for Real Estate Lead Qualification System
job_description:
Please include the word "aubergine" at the start of your reply...

Seeking a skilled AI automation freelancer to develop and implement a fully automated lead qualification and nurturing system for a real estate client. The goal is to build a system that efficiently processes inbound leads from various online sources, uses AI to qualify them based on predefined criteria (identifying buyer vs. seller intent and key information), and nurtures them through automated communication until they are fully qualified and ready for direct engagement with the realtor.

This project requires expertise in integrating AI and automation tools (like n8n) to streamline lead flow, automate communication, and deliver high-quality, qualified leads.

Responsibilities:
•	Design and build an end-to-end AI-powered lead qualification and nurturing workflow.
•	Integrate with multiple lead sources, including but not limited to: 
o	Email platforms
o	Website forms and contact points
o	Social media channels (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn)
o	CRM systems (e.g., Zillow, Realtor.com integrations)
o	SMS/Text messaging services (implementation details to be discussed)
o	Potential website chatbot integration
•	Program AI logic to: 
o	Distinguish between buyer and seller leads.
o	Apply a predefined qualification checklist for each lead type (e.g., budget, property preferences for buyers; property details for sellers).
o	Dynamically generate and send follow-up questions via appropriate communication channels (email, SMS, potentially social media DMs).
o	Implement automated follow-up sequences based on lead engagement.
o	Accurately determine when a lead meets all qualification criteria.
•	Configure a system for delivering fully qualified leads to the client, which may include: 
o	Real-time notifications (e.g., SMS, email).
o	Direct integration with the client's CRM.
o	Optional integration with a calendar system for automated appointment booking (phone calls, consultations).
•	Utilize a robust automation platform like n8n (highly preferred, as it aligns with the client's understanding of potential solutions) or demonstrate strong proficiency with alternative suitable platforms (e.g., Zapier, Make/Integromat).
•	Provide clear documentation of the developed system for future reference.

Skills and Experience:
•	Proven track record as a freelancer in developing AI-driven automation solutions.
•	Strong understanding of AI/ML principles relevant to lead qualification and natural language processing.
•	Hands-on experience with automation platforms (n8n is a significant plus).
•	Demonstrated ability to integrate with various APIs and web services.
•	Proficiency in relevant programming languages (e.g., JavaScript for n8n).
•	Experience in designing efficient  workflows and automation logic.
•	Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
•	Ability to work independently and manage project timelines effectively.
•	Prior experience with real estate lead management or similar qualification processes is an advantage.
Project Deliverables:
•	A fully functional and tested AI-powered lead qualification and nurturing system.
•	Successful integration with all specified lead sources and client platforms.
•	A reliable mechanism for delivering qualified leads to the client (and optional calendar integration).
•	Comprehensive documentation of the system setup and operation.

Please submit a proposal that includes:
•	Your relevant experience with AI automation projects, particularly those involving lead qualification or similar workflows.
•	Your preferred automation platform(s) and your level of expertise with each.
•	Your proposed approach to building this system, including any initial ideas or considerations.
•	Your estimated timeline and cost for completing this project.
•	Examples or a portfolio of your previous relevant work.

Looking for a proactive and results-oriented freelancer who can deliver a high-quality, efficient lead qualification solution.

job_title: Principal AI Architect
job_description:
We are looking for a full time hire to be a Principal AI Architect. Are you interested?

You would lead our AI engineering and design for all our clients.

Agencies please do not apply, we are looking for a person, not a group.

Primary Role:

The AI Architect is responsible for designing and implementing intelligent AI-driven workflows that integrate seamlessly with automation platforms like Make.com, Zapier, and custom API solutions. This role focuses on retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), vector databases, and AI-powered knowledge retrieval, ensuring AI systems can efficiently store, retrieve, and leverage contextual information to optimize decision-making and automation.

Point of View (POV)
"I am an AI Architect responsible for designing and implementing intelligent AI-driven workflows that seamlessly integrate with automation platforms like Make.com, Zapier, and custom API solutions. My expertise lies in retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), vector databases, and AI-powered knowledge retrieval, ensuring that AI systems can efficiently store, retrieve, and leverage contextual information.
I design and optimize AI-driven automation pipelines that enhance decision-making and operational efficiency. By integrating vector databases like Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS, and Chroma, I enable advanced semantic search and retrieval systems that improve AI accuracy and response quality.
My role also involves API integration, embedding optimization, and AI model fine-tuning, ensuring smooth interactions between AI systems and business applications. I proactively monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and document architectures to drive scalable, reliable, and cost-effective AI solutions.
As part of a collaborative team, I work with stakeholders to align AI-powered automation and knowledge retrieval strategies with business objectives, always staying ahead of the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and intelligent automation."

Core Accountabilities:

AI Workflow Design & Development
Architect and implement AI-powered automation workflows integrating with tools such as Make.com, Zapier, and other automation platforms.
Design modular, scalable systems that leverage AI for decision-making and process automation.
Continuously optimize workflows for efficiency, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.


Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) & Knowledge Retrieval
Develop and optimize RAG pipelines to enhance AI-driven search and retrieval.
Implement vector database solutions (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS, Chroma) for semantic search and knowledge storage.
Fine-tune retrieval strategies to improve AI-generated responses and contextual awareness.


Integration & API Management
Develop and maintain custom integrations between AI models, vector databases, APIs, and automation platforms.
Optimize embedding storage and retrieval mechanisms for seamless AI interaction.
Ensure API reliability, security, and efficiency within AI-driven architectures.


AI Model Implementation & Optimization
Deploy and fine-tune LLMs, embedding models, and AI-driven workflows.
Work on knowledge retrieval optimizations to ensure accurate and context-aware AI outputs.
Continuously monitor and improve AI model performance within automation pipelines.


System Performance, Documentation & Collaboration
Monitor workflow performance, retrieval accuracy, and AI system reliability.
Maintain clear documentation of architectures, integrations, and best practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI-powered solutions with business needs.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Petroleum Engineer
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Petroleum Engineers or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

job_title: Excel-based Revenue and ROI Calculator
job_description:
Objective:
To transform our current Excel-based ROI and Revenue Projection tool into a visually engaging, branded, and intuitive sales asset that clearly communicates profitability and return timelines for our device — while also providing side-by-side competitor comparisons to help sales close more effectively.

Key Improvements Required:
1. Visual Graphics Integration
Pie charts for treatment revenue breakdown.

Bar/line charts for ROI growth and payback period.

Cumulative ROI vs. device cost chart.

All charts must auto-update with input changes.

2. Cost vs. ROI Calculator
Input fields for:

Device cost

Tax

Interest rate

Loan term

Auto-calculate monthly payments.

Compare monthly payment to projected revenue.

Visualize time to break even and total profit over 5 years.

3. NEW: Device Revenue Comparison – Ours vs. Competitor
Purpose: Let the customer directly compare expected performance of our device with a competitor’s — side-by-side. This arms the rep with objective, visual  that makes our offering more compelling.

Inputs for both devices:

Device price (including tax, financing terms)

Avg revenue per treatment

Treatments per week

Consumables cost (if applicable)

Monthly revenue and cost inputs

Outputs:

Monthly net profit comparison

Time to ROI

1, 3, 5-year profitability

Total profit after 5 years

Visuals to include:

Stacked bar or side-by-side bar chart comparing monthly and cumulative profit.

Line graph showing ROI trajectory over time for both devices.

Table summary of:

Time to break even

Total revenue and total cost

ROI percentage

Consumables cost difference

Freelancer Instructions:

Inputs for both devices must be editable.

Output section should be clearly labeled and visually intuitive.

Charts must clearly differentiate the two devices (color coded).

Optional: Add a “Key Advantages” note section for our reps to write in personalized selling points.

4. Color Coding & Layout Design
Blue = inputs, Green = positive profit, Red = cost/loss, Yellow = break-even

Use grouped cells, tabbed sections, or color-blocked layouts to guide users visually

Use conditional formatting to help with quick insights

5. Branding
Add logo, consistent brand colors and fonts.

Include a short explainer/instructions section at the top.

6. PDF Exportability
Set print area for clean export to PDF (max 2 pages).

Include both our ROI + competitor comparison in export.

Use landscape format, include charts and key financials.

Bonus Suggestions (Optional):
Add dropdown with pre-loaded competitor benchmarks (if  available).

Include toggle to show "best-case" and "conservative" scenarios.

Add slider or scenario tools for reps to adjust treatment volume or pricing.

Deliverables:
Branded, interactive Excel calculator with:

Visual ROI and revenue outputs

Financing + break-even calculations

Competitor comparison section

Exportable PDF format (print-optimized)

Clear instructions + color-coded layout

job_title: Efficient Business Tracking System on Google Sheets
job_description:
Project Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Google Sheets specialist to develop a custom system for efficiently tracking inventory and costs associated with buying and selling sports cards on the WhatNot app. The system will allow the user to input purchase details, manage inventory, and easily calculate cost of goods sold for each livestream show. The goal is to automate and streamline the process of managing inventory, determining costs, and tracking revenue, ensuring an organized and error-free experience.



Project Objective:

The primary objective is to design a Google Sheets-based system that will allow us to:


Track inventory: Log details of each purchase, including the number of items, total cost, and specific details for each item.

Calculate costs for partial inventory sales: Enable automatic calculations of the average cost for groups of cards, especially when only part of a batch is sold.

Display inventory details visually: Allow users to upload pictures and add relevant specifics to each inventory record.

Integrate sales tracking: Track revenue generated from WhatNot sales and compare it with the cost of goods sold for a specific show.

-------
System Requirements:

Inventory Tracking:

Deal Logging: Users can input the details of each purchase, such as:

Seller information

Number of cards purchased

Total cost of the deal

Item descriptions (e.g., card types, series, condition, etc.)

Date of purchase

Quantity and Cost Calculation: Automatically calculate the average cost per card in a batch for cases when multiple cards are purchased together.

Example: A purchase of 57 cards for $350, but only 30 cards are sold in a given show. The system should calculate the average cost of each card and subtract the appropriate cost of goods for the sold inventory.

Sales Tracking:

A section for tracking WhatNot revenue: After each show, enter the revenue generated from that show along with details of the transaction fees and shipping charges.

A formula to calculate the cost of goods sold (COGS) based on the number of items sold, including partial inventory batches.

Inventory Visuals:

Allow users to upload images of individual cards or batches, so each item can be visually identified within the system.

Maintain image links to each product record for easy reference.

Show Summary:

A summary page where the total revenue, cost of goods sold (COGS), and net profit from each livestream show are tracked and automatically updated.

The ability to view past sales performance and easily calculate profit margins per show.

 Integrity & Ease of Use:

The system should be user-friendly, with easy  input and no manual calculations required from the user.

It should be scalable as inventory grows and should handle varying quantities and deal complexities.

Cost & Profit Analysis:

A section for profit/loss analysis that will allow us to see the return on investment for each batch of cards purchased, showing profit margins based on the cost of goods and revenue generated.

-------

Scope of Work:

Initial Consultation and Design

Discuss the specific needs of the user regarding inventory and sales tracking.

Outline preferred layout and flow for the system.

Design an easy-to-use interface that will be intuitive for someone without technical expertise.

Development

Set up and configure the Google Sheets document to track inventory, calculate average costs, and track sales .

Integrate image upload functionality and linking for inventory images.

Build automated formulas for sales tracking, including revenue, transaction fees, and shipping costs.

Testing and Adjustments

Test the system with sample  to ensure proper functioning.

Make necessary adjustments based on feedback or issues identified during testing.

Training and Handover

Provide a tutorial or documentation explaining how to use the system, including how to input  and interpret results.

Offer support for any questions or troubleshooting for the first few weeks after the system is deployed.

job_title: Databricks Architect
job_description:
Job Title: Databricks Architect
Location: Remote
 Type: Contract or Full-Time
 Reports to: Head of , ML & AI

About Us
We are a Databricks Partner focused on , Machine Learning (ML), and Artificial Intelligence (AI) services. Our goal is to help businesses modernize their  platforms, leverage advanced analytics, and implement scalable AI solutions.
We are seeking a highly skilled Databricks Architect to play a critical role in pre-sales, solution architecture, and project execution. This role will involve working directly with customers, defining project scopes, estimating implementations, and guiding  engineers during project execution.
This position is available as either a contract or full-time opportunity based on experience and preference.

Job Overview
As a Databricks Architect, you will be responsible for engaging with customers, designing -driven solutions, and providing hands-on technical leadership. You will work closely with sales teams, customers, and internal engineering teams to develop Lakehouse architectures, big  platforms, and AI-powered analytics using Databricks.
This is a client-facing role that requires expertise in  engineering, ML/AI workloads, and Databricks best practices, along with pre-sales experience to scope and estimate projects.

Key Responsibilities
Pre-Sales & Solution Architecture
Engage with customers to understand business challenges, define  strategy, and assess technical requirements.
Design scalable, high-performance  solutions using Databricks, Apache Spark, Delta Lake, and MLflow.
Develop and deliver technical presentations, proof-of-concepts (PoCs), and solution proposals for customers.
Collaborate with sales and business development teams to scope, estimate, and propose  and AI projects.
Identify opportunities to integrate ML/AI solutions within Databricks-based architectures.
Project Execution & Technical Leadership
Act as the technical lead for Databricks implementations, guiding  engineers through architecture, development, and deployment phases.
Provide hands-on support for  pipeline optimization, performance tuning, and troubleshooting.
Ensure best practices in security,  governance, and compliance within Databricks environments.
Work with MLOps teams to deploy machine learning models at scale using Databricks.
Implement  automation and orchestration pipelines to streamline  processing and analytics workflows.
Partnership & Innovation
Stay up to date with Databricks roadmap, new features, and best practices to drive innovation.
Work closely with Databricks partner teams to leverage partner incentives and funding programs.
Contribute to internal knowledge sharing, training sessions, and mentoring junior team members.

Qualifications & Requirements
✅ Must-Have:
5+ years of experience in  architecture,  engineering, or AI/ML solutions, with a focus on big  and analytics.
3+ years of hands-on experience with Databricks, including Apache Spark, Delta Lake, and MLflow.
Databricks Certifications (Mandatory):
Databricks Certified  Engineer Associate (or higher)
Databricks Certified Solutions Architect
Expertise in cloud-agnostic  architectures, with experience on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and Spark-based frameworks for  engineering and AI/ML applications.
Experience in pre-sales, solution scoping, and technical estimations for  and AI projects.
Knowledge of  governance, security, and compliance best practices.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience engaging both technical and business stakeholders.
✅ Nice-to-Have:
Additional Databricks Certifications (Machine Learning, SQL Analyst, etc.).
Experience with Lakehouse Architecture and  warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery).
Experience with real-time streaming  architectures (Kafka, Kinesis, Event Hub).
Familiarity with AI/ML workloads and MLOps within Databricks.
Background in consulting or client-facing roles, demonstrating strong relationship-building skills.

What We Offer
Flexible contract or full-time opportunity, based on experience and preference.
Fully remote work environment, with occasional travel for client meetings and partner events.
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge  and AI projects with enterprise clients.
Collaboration with a talented team of cloud-agnostic  engineers, AI specialists, and architects.
Competitive compensation, based on experience and engagement type.

How to Apply
If you are a Databricks expert with a passion for  architecture, AI/ML, and technical leadership, we’d love to hear from you! Apply with your resume and a brief introduction on why you’re a great fit for this role.

This Databricks Architect role is perfect for someone who excels in solution architecture, pre-sales, and hands-on  engineering leadership, while working with enterprise AI and analytics workloads in the cloud-agnostic Databricks ecosystem. 🚀

job_title: Customer Cross Sell / 2 year Value Analysis
job_description:
Overview:
We are a multi-trade company offering HVAC Installation, HVAC Service, Electrical, and Plumbing. Our revenue is divided into commercial and residential, but this project will focus only on residential customers, who make up the majority of our business.

Using Service Fusion (CRM) and QuickBooks, we would like to analyze the lifetime value of new residential customers who first used our HVAC Service in 2022. You may have to use API access to get the information you need. We have a programmer who can grant you this API access.

Key Questions to Answer:
Customer Count
How many new residential customers came to us through HVAC Service in 2022?

Initial Revenue
What was the initial revenue generated from these customers during their first HVAC Service interaction?

Repeat Usage by Trade
How many additional times did these customers use our company (after the first visit) through:
HVAC Service
HVAC Installation
Plumbing
Electrical

Follow-Up Revenue by Trade
How much additional revenue did we generate from these customers in each trade (after the first visit)?
HVAC Service
HVAC Installation
Plumbing
Electrical
Total Revenue (combined)

Average Customer Lifetime Value (To Date)
What is the average total revenue per customer (as of now) for this 2022 HVAC Service cohort?

Deliverables:
A detailed explanation of the methodology and logic used to arrive at each number.
A breakdown of the  for internal review, including filters, definitions, and criteria used.
A backup Excel file or report with raw or exportable  from Service Fusion and/or QuickBooks that allows us to double-check your work.

job_title: Entry
job_description:
We’re looking for a detail-oriented, reliable Social Media Manager to help us set up and manage new TikTok, Instagram, Youtube accounts. We will provide you with all content, profile photos, names, and any other necessary details. Your responsibilities will include:

ALL Posting will be required to be done on mobile device

Account Creation & Setup

Create a new email address and new social media accounts (TikTok & Instagram & Youtube) following our guidelines.
Upload the profile photo and complete the account profile details.
Account Warm-Up

For the first 3 days, log in and “warm up” the new accounts by spending at least 15 minutes interacting with relevant content each day (liking, commenting, scrolling, etc.) to establish natural activity before official posting begins.
Total time spent in account creation and warming up for the 3 days is expected to be around 1 hour total.
Daily Posting & Engagement

Post 3 times a day, every day, on both TikTok, Instagram and Youtube.

We will you provide content examples and inspiration but you will be required to make the content. You’ll be responsible for uploading it, writing the captions (if needed), and scheduling the drafts on your phone.
Each post requires a quick period of scrolling (5 minutes) in the niche to maintain authentic engagement.
Time Commitment:

Week 1: Estimated 4–5 hours (includes account setup, initial warm-up, and getting all draft content ready).
Subsequent Weeks: Estimated 2–3 hours each week (primarily handling the daily postings and quick engagement).
Why Work With Us:

If this initial collaboration is successful (after a week or two), we plan to scale up to manage multiple pages, offering more hours and opportunity for growth.
We value consistency, communication, and reliability, and are excited to build a long-term partnership.


COMPENSATION
This pay would be a flat rate of $150 per month to post 3x a day across all 3 platforms.

job_title: Snowflake Administrator
job_description:

Provide technology leadership in driving large complex Snowflake implementations. Design and develop features, understand customer requirements, and meet business goals.

What you will do?

13. Recommend the Snowflake best practices for management, monitoring, and optimization

What do you have?
1. Good sense of Warehouse architecture for performance optimization and scalability on Snowflake.
2. Hands-on working experience in Snowflake, Snow-pipe, SnowSQL, Replication, -sharing, -ingestion into Snowflake, etc.

4. 3+ years of experience in the complete life cycle of EDW projects and a good understanding of dimensional modeling.
5. 2+ years of experience in ad-hoc  analysis, solution design, and reporting dashboards.
6. 2+ years of experience with real-time  ingestion techniques.

Life at Mactores

We care about creating a culture that makes a real difference in the lives of every Mactorian. Our 10 Core Leadership Principles that honor Decision-making, Leadership, Collaboration, and Curiosity drive how we work.

1. Be one step ahead
2. Deliver the best

At Mactores, we are committed to providing equal opportunities in all of our employment practices, and we do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local laws. Company:B&B CRM
Location: Remote

Compensation: Competitive / Hourly or Fixed-Rate (Based on Experience)

About the Project
B&B  is undergoing a digital transformation initiative to modernize its quote generation and customer management systems. As part of this initiative, we are developing a Quote Management System leveraging Airtable as the centralized database—fully integrated with GoHighLevel (GHL) to create a dynamic and automated workflow for quote creation, client engagement, and backend  sync. Currently we have a spreadsheet in Google sheets that is setup to integrate with GHL.We can provide sheets with Formulas and working calculations That are linked to GHL. 
Scope of Work
We are seeking a technically proficient Airtable expert with proven experience integrating Airtable with GoHighLevel (GHL) and building smart, automated quoting tools. You will be responsible for architecting and implementing a scalable system that supports:
Dynamic quote creation and version control
Real-time  syncing between Airtable and GHL (via webhooks, APIs, or middleware like Zapier or Make)
Automated quote status workflows (e.g., Draft - Sent -Approved - Expired)
Branded quote output (PDF, email-ready formats)
User-friendly quote builder views for internal sales teams
 integrity between GHL CRM contacts/opportunities and Airtable tables
Administrative interface for product pricing, tax rules, and optional upsells

Key Responsibilities
Architect the Airtable Base to serve as the centralized database for quote line items, pricing, discounts, and client records
Integrate with GoHighLevel CRM, syncing contact and opportunity , and triggering quote creation workflows
Automate Workflows for sending quotes, updating statuses, and capturing approvals
Implement Branded Output using Airtable Extensions, Zapier/Make, or tools like Formstack Docs / Google Docs templating
Optimize for Reusability, ensuring the base can scale across additional Gulf Aluminum sales regions and reps
Document the Build for future internal use, updates, and onboarding

Technical Requirements
Expert-level proficiency in Airtable (Formulas, Linked Records, Interfaces, Extensions)
Experience integrating Airtable with GoHighLevel (via API, Webhooks, Zapier, or Make.com)
Familiarity with quote-building logic (pricing rules, tax rates, dynamic line items, discounts)
PDF generation tools and workflows (Google Docs, Documint, or similar)
Workflow automation across platforms (Zapier, Make.com)
Strong documentation, communication, and problem-solving skills

Bonus Experience
Familiarity with construction or manufacturing quoting (especially aluminum, fabrication, or contractor industries)
UI/UX experience designing internal tools for non-technical sales reps
White-label deployment strategies

Timeline & Deliverables
Phase 1 (MVP): Airtable base connected to GHL with quoting capabilities live within 3 weeks
Phase 2 (Enhancements): Branded output, automation improvements, and client-side approval flows
Potential for additional projects post-delivery

📩 Apply Now
Send your proposal with:
Brief overview of similar Airtable projects (especially CRM or quote-related)
Your preferred toolstack (Zapier, Make, custom scripting, etc.)
Availability & rate (hourly or fixed project pricing)
Any portfolio or GitHub/code samples (if applicable)

job_title: Survey Consultant for a Creative App
job_description:
We're looking for a thoughtful and detail-oriented Survey Consultant to help us analyze and report on 1–2 recurring research surveys for a creative photography app. This is a project-based role running through April and May 2025, ideal for someone who enjoys turning survey  into clear, compelling stories.

🌟 Project Overview
We run the following 2 research surveys every 6 months—one focused on our users, and one on our target audience and competitive landscape. You may be supporting one or both of the following:
・User Segmentation Survey – helps us understand who our users are, including demographics, characteristics and use cases.
・Brand Survey – looks at how our brand and our competitors are perceived in the market, including awareness, usage, and competitive positioning.

📸 Survey Details
Both surveys were last conducted in Q4 2024. We're looking for your help to replicate them this Spring.
・You’ll be provided with past deliverables as templates.
・Our internal team owns survey methodology and fielding. You’ll receive new raw  collected in April 2025 (exported from SurveyMonkey). You'll be responsible for tabulating and synthesizing results.
・Each survey includes 15–20 questions (mix of single- and multi-select), with one open-ended question.
・No advanced statistical analysis is needed—just clear, accurate tabulation using Google Sheets.

📌 Deliverables
You’ll help us bring the  to life and keep our reporting consistent over time. For each survey, your deliverables will include:
・A Google Sheets tabulation of the raw , following our Q4 2024 format.
・A Google Slides deck (~25–30 slides), structured like our previous report and highlighting key insights and trends in a compelling (and even fun?) way.
・No need to present the deck—our internal team will handle the final readout.

✅ Desired skills and qualifications
・5+ years of experience analyzing survey research using SurveyMonkey and Google Sheets.
・Experience creating polished, visually engaging reports in Google Slides.
・High attention to detail, with a strong focus on  accuracy.
・Ability to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
・Bonus: Familiarity or passion for the creator economy or photography industry.

If this sounds like you, please send us a message. We're looking forward to connecting and hopefully working together!

job_title: Integration with OST, Quick Bid, and Microsoft Project
job_description:
Integration with OST, Quick Bid, and Microsoft Project

a.  Extraction (ETL Process)
•	OST: Export takeoff  (quantities, types of work) via CSV or API if supported.
•	Quick Bid: Extract labor and cost estimates; exports to Excel/CSV are often supported.
•	Microsoft Project: Use the Microsoft Project  Interchange (MPX/MPP) format or its Project API (CSOM/REST) to read/write task and resource .
You’ll need middleware that:
•	Pulls takeoff and bid  from OST and Quick Bid,
•	Maps that  to tasks, durations, and resource types for Microsoft Project.
Tools to Use:
•	Python or Node.js for building integration services.
•	Pandas, NumPy (Python) for  manipulation.
•	Microsoft Graph API or Project Web API to programmatically modify schedules.
🧮 3. Scheduling Engine
Build or integrate a constraint-based scheduler:

Use a task dependency graph (like in MS Project: Predecessors, Lags, etc.)

Adjust timelines in real-time as manpower changes.

Open-source options:

OptaPlanner (Java)

Google OR-Tools

ProjectLibre (MS Project-like open-source tool with modifiable source)

🖥️ 4. User Interface
Design a dashboard that:

Displays the current project schedule,

Allows slider/inputs to increase or decrease crew per trade,

Shows how that affects the schedule in real-time.

Tech Stack Ideas:
Frontend: React or Vue.js

Backend: FastAPI (Python), Node.js, or Django

Database: PostgreSQL or MongoDB (to store schedule snapshots, user settings, etc.)

🔗 5. Automation & Updates

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Clinical  Manager
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Clinical  Managers or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

job_title: Convert SPSS code to STATA
job_description:
Walker has been using SPSS code to extract  from a SQL reporting database for many years. Each month we extract service  from our electronic health record database and format what is needed for the funding school district (LEA) to submit for Medicaid reimbursement. All students are enrolled in the Walker Day program, about half are also enrolled in the Walker Residential program. Students who are fully funded by their school district can be reimbursed for therapeutic services in the Residential program, while students who are not funded by a school district are not eligible for Medicaid reimbursement in either the Walker Day or Residential program.

In addition to pulling  from multiple tables in the SQL database, the existing SPSS code performs three other functions:

1. Pulls diagnostic information saved in a spreadsheet on Walker’s network drive by child and service type

2. Reformats the name of the employee who delivered the service with their certification and, if not licensed, who their supervisor is

3. Enters the appropriate billing code based on service type, which program delivered the service (Walker Day or Residential) and whether the service was delivered individually or in a group.

The final result should be a CSV file with each eligible service on its own line, listing the students name and identifying numbers followed by the funding school district and the specific service  with the above inserts and transformations.

job_title: Scientist - Tableau (Contractor)
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
Overview

We are looking for a part-time (20-30 hours/week)  scientist or  analyst to contract with us on building internal reporting dashboards in Tableau for www.GoodParty.org, where our mission is to make people matter more than money in our democracy.  

This role is primarily focused on dashboard development and minor  transformation, supporting various teams across the organization. You will work with an existing  science contractor and collaborate with team leads as key stakeholders. This is a contract position for 4-6 weeks depending on start date, with the potential to extend.

About GoodParty.org:

GoodParty.org is empowering Independents to run, win, and serve so we can transform civic leadership. In 2024, we helped elect 3,444 Independent candidates into local offices across 48 states. Why?

Americans – especially young people – have been losing faith in democracy. The rigged, two-party system has turned “Independent” into a dirty word. Voters are trapped between choosing the lesser of two evils or sitting out elections altogether.

A majority of eligible voters (over 130M Americans), including more than half of Millennials and Gen Z, say that neither Republicans nor Democrats represent them. But they keep getting re-elected! Whether you’re concerned about healthcare costs, wars, the environment, our individual freedoms, or inequality, many great solutions are held back by the dark doom loop of dysfunctional partisan politics. 

While mainstream media and the two major parties focus on federal elections (Congress and the President), GoodParty.org is building from the bottom up. With over 500,000 elected offices in the United States—70% of which are uncontested—GoodParty.org is powering the movement to reclaim our communities from career politicians. We’re helping independents in local and state-level campaigns nationwide. Together, we’re building a truly representative democracy where society’s biggest problems are solved.

How?

GoodParty.org empowers independents to run, win, and serve in public office without the influence of partisan or big-money support. Through our free, AI-powered tools, we enable independent candidates to prioritize people over parties and community over corporate funding, transforming real people into civic heroes. We’re a platform, not a political party. 

And, it’s working! Starting with 11 wins in the 2023 election cycle, GoodParty.org set an audacious goal for 1,000 wins in 2024. We beat expectations – 3,444 candidates won this past November and are serving in office across 48 states! 40.3 million voters (26% of all 2024 voters) cast a ballot for our 6,317 candidates. Our general election win rate was 54.5%.

Looking ahead, we’re building on our momentum and expanding our product offerings to help candidates deliver on their promises and serve their constituents effectively. Candidates who partner with us come from across the ideological spectrum and pledge to uphold people-powered principles, anti-corruption practices, and a commitment to civility. Together, we aim to transform civic leadership, bringing real accountability to public service and setting a new standard of leaders who prioritize the people they serve.  GoodParty.org is founded by serial entrepreneur, Farhad Mohit, with over $1B in exits — Flipagram (now TikTok), Shopzilla, and BizRate.

What you’ll do:

Develop and refine internal-facing Tableau dashboards based on stakeholder requirements.

Perform minor  transformations to ensure  is visualization-ready (may involve direct work in Databricks, PostgreSQL, or dbt).

Assist with wireframing dashboard layouts and interpreting metrics.

Collaborate with team leads and the  science contractor to align dashboards with organizational goals.

Test and iterate on visualizations to optimize usability and insight delivery for cross-functional teams.

Who you are:

Strong expertise in Tableau, with a focus on building dashboards and applying  visualization best practices.

3+ years experience as a  analyst or  scientist.

Experience with tools like Databricks, PostgreSQL, or dbt for light  transformation tasks.

Familiarity with Figma, Balsamiq, or similar wireframing tools for designing dashboard layouts.

Comfort with developing and refining internal Tableau dashboards based on stakeholder needs.

Ability to thrive in a part-time contractor role, committing 20-30 hours per week for a minimum of 4 weeks, with potential for extension.

Bonus if: 

You have familiarity with political/election reporting metrics

You have worked at a -driven startup 

You have experience studying, working, or volunteering in politics, political activism, or democracy reform

You’re sick of sitting on the sidelines watching our democracy fail to meet its potential

Why you should work at GoodParty.org:

Join us in solving the biggest problem of our time – fixing our democracy – so all other problems can be solved.

We’re a Public Benefit Corporation that prioritizes social impact over making money.

Work where and how you like, on a fully remote team spread across the country.

Join a passionate team with diverse political views focused on one mission.

We’re fully funded for our mission. No stressing over whether the next round of funding will come through. Focus on making an impact. That’s what matters here.

The pay rate for this remote contractor position will be between $45 to $60 per hour. This range reflects the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. The hourly rate will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, skills, seniority, education, qualifications, certifications, and organizational needs. We reserve the right to modify this pay range at any time.

We are not considering candidates currently based outside of the US, so please only apply if you are physically located in the US. Unfortunately, we are not able to provide sponsorship for any of our roles at this time.

Interested candidates should submit:
Resume outlining relevant experience

About Our Company:

RankPay is a digital marketing services company with a focus on results-driven custom solutions. An industry leader for over 10 years, we disrupted the SEO industry by introducing the revolutionary pay-for-performance service model in 2007.

We’ve since broadened into offering a full suite of services, expanding our specializations into content marketing, pay-per-click advertising, website design and maintenance, and more.


About This Position:

As a Digital Marketing Account Director, you’ll be primarily responsible for managing and growing a portfolio of existing digital marketing accounts. You’ll spend most of your time communicating directly with your clients, quarterbacking execution with specialist teams, and analyzing .

Your primary goal will be to build and maintain strong, positive relationships, and drive results through ensuring execution across various fulfillment teams.

If you’re a self-starter with extensive SEO and PPC experience, and the people skills required to navigate mid-market sales and account management, then this is the role for you.


Responsibilities:

- Serve as the primary account lead for your assigned clients and leads, and act as a subject matter expert for all of our digital marketing services (primarily SEO & PPC).
- Conduct sales calls with leads.

- Set and manage client expectations.

Requirements:

- 2+ years SEO and PPC experience
- 2+ years account management experience
- Experience selling and closing service agreements valued at or above $25k-$100k per year
- Excellent oral and written communication skills
- Ability to build & maintain strong customer relationships
- Must be a self-starter with good time management and organizational skills


Benefits:

- Competitive compensation
- Work from anywhere (fully distributed team)
- Flexible time-off policy
- Ongoing professional development and training
- Talented and multi-dimensional team

At RankPay our goal is to provide our clients with superior services and exceptional customer service. Our Digital Marketing Account Directors play a key role in our mission to help small and midmarket businesses grow their presence online.

RankPay is an Equal Opportunity Employer. RankPay does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

job_title: Build Script to Analyze UPS Shipments for Late Delivery Refunds
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
📝 Job Description:

We’re looking for a skilled Python developer to create a script that connects to the UPS API, retrieves tracking  for recent shipments, and flags packages that were delivered late according to UPS delivery guarantees (making them eligible for a refund).

This script will help us automate refund requests for late deliveries.

⸻

✅ Deliverables:
	•	Authenticate with UPS API using OAuth 2.0 (client_credentials or authorization_code flow as needed)
	•	Retrieve tracking  for a list of UPS tracking numbers (we can provide a CSV or query a range of shipment dates)
	•	Parse delivery dates vs. guaranteed delivery dates
	•	Identify and list packages that were delivered late
	•	Output a report (CSV or JSON) showing:
	•	Tracking number
	•	Ship date
	•	Scheduled delivery date
	•	Actual delivery date
	•	Delivery status (on time / late)
	•	(Optional but preferred): Integrate with UPS Refund Request API to submit claims automatically
	•	Error handling for invalid or failed API calls
	•	Script should be easy to run locally (Python 3.x, requests, etc.)

⸻

💼 Ideal Skills:
	•	Python (required)
	•	Experience with UPS API or other carrier APIs (FedEx, USPS, etc.)
	•	Familiarity with OAuth 2.0 flows
	•	Working with JSON, CSV, and REST APIs
	•	Basic knowledge of shipping/delivery logistics is a plus

⸻

📂 What We Provide:
	•	UPS Developer credentials (client ID / secret)
	•	Test tracking numbers
	•	UPS Developer documentation
	•	Access to a test or production UPS account

⸻

🕒 Timeline:

We’re hoping to get a working MVP within 1 week, with time after for refinement and optional automation.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Training and Development Specialist
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Training and Development Specialist or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

The CSV should match the format we typically export from the system’s web UI and will be used in Power BI, though we do not need assistance with that integration.  

The script should pull all tickets from the start of the year up to the present. Ideally, it should also support retrieving only tickets that have been updated since the last run. A bonus will be awarded if this delta sync functionality is implemented efficiently. The CSV file must match the structure of our manual exports and be saved to a specific folder controlled by an environmental variable.  

To ensure reliability, the script must handle API timeouts with proper retry logic and error handling. Since this script will run weekly, it should be robust enough to execute consistently without manual intervention.  

We will provide API keys, a sample CSV export for reference, and details on any previous attempts we've made. Experience in Python API integrations, error handling, and CSV  processing is essential. If you can efficiently implement delta updates, that would be a strong plus.  

Please include relevant experience and a rough estimate of the time required for completion.

job_title: Professionally Design Already Built Excel Trading Journal
job_description:
I developed a stock trading journal in Excel and I'm looking for an Excel expert to help design it to be more user friendly and look more like a software rather than an Excel spreadsheet. 

The core functionality is built and designed clean (however, again, the design is not good). Here's a brief overview of what's in the spreadsheet:

- 12 monthly sheets (jan-dec) for users to manually input individual Trading . There are per-trade automatic calculations for p/l, profit %, risk, R-multiple etc. there is also a dropdown list for each trade for users to assign a particular strategy to a trade for metric tracking purposes (more on that next 👇)

- There's a strategy zone page where users can create 5 different strategies and all the rules that apply to each. They can then name the strategy which links to the monthly sheets drop down lists I described earlier. This sheet also has automatic table  for 3, 6, and 12 month rolling averages  for various metrics per strategy and global per strategy . There is a table that automatically ranks and picks the best strategy based on average R-multiple. There's a few graphs on there also. 

- There's a dashboard sheet with a few charts and various automatic performance  for the global account. 

- there's a journaling sheet for users to write details about each trade and select from a dropdown whether they one or lost the trade then record the mistake that they made. The journal will automatically pull the average most and least common mistake.

These core functions are already built. I'm just looking for it to be designed to look like a software and generally look better. I'm aware that some of this project may require rebuilding some functionality. 

I've created several of these so there's opportunity for ongoing projects. 

The core functionality is already built. Everything I described above is currently in the file and I can send the file over to the person who's hired to work from. Nothing described needs to be built into the template. I only need it to be designed. 

I look forward to speaking with you!

job_title: Senior Playwright Web Scraping Developer (Postgresql/Drizzle)
job_description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Playwright Web Scraping Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining sophisticated web scraping scripts using Playwright and TypeScript, with a focus on storing and managing extracted  in a Postgresql database utilizing Drizzle as an Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) tool. You will tackle complex challenges, including navigating dynamic websites, overcoming anti-scraping measures like CAPTCHAs, extracting intricate  objects, automating document downloads, and integrating the scraped  into our Postgresql database using Drizzle's efficient  modeling and query capabilities.

The ideal candidate possesses deep expertise in advanced Playwright techniques, a strong understanding of modern web technologies, experience with database management using Postgresql, and familiarity with Drizzle for seamless interaction between the application code and the database. This role requires the ability to design and implement scalable  storage solutions, ensuring  integrity, consistency, and performance.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design, code, test, and deploy robust and scalable web scraping solutions using Playwright and TypeScript.
- Implement advanced scraping techniques to handle dynamic content loading (SPAs, AJAX), complex user interactions, and intricate website structures.
- Develop and integrate strategies for bypassing various CAPTCHA challenges and other anti-bot mechanisms.
- Expertly scrape and parse complex  structures (nested objects, tables, lists) from HTML and dynamically generated content.
- Implement functionality to reliably download various document types (PDFs, CSVs, images, etc.) encountered during scraping processes.
- Utilize Postgresql to design and implement efficient database schemas for storing scraped , ensuring  normalization, and optimizing query performance.
- Leverage Drizzle to interact with the Postgresql database, defining models that represent the scraped , and performing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations efficiently.
- Monitor, maintain, and optimize existing scraping scripts and database integrations for performance, reliability, and efficiency.
- Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to script failures, website changes, blocking mechanisms, or database connectivity problems.
- Collaborate with relevant teams (e.g.,  analysts, backend engineers) to understand  requirements, ensure  quality, and align database design with project needs.
- Stay current with the latest developments in Playwright, TypeScript, web scraping best practices, anti-scraping technologies, Postgresql features, and Drizzle capabilities.
- Document code, methodologies, and processes clearly, including database schema designs and API interactions.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
- Proven professional experience building complex web scrapers specifically with Playwright.
- Advanced proficiency in Playwright API, including handling complex selectors, browser contexts, page interactions, network interception, and navigation strategies.
- Strong programming skills in TypeScript and its ecosystem (Node.js).
- Demonstrated experience implementing CAPTCHA bypassing techniques (familiarity with recognition services or advanced interaction simulation).
- Proven ability to scrape and structure  from complex, nested web elements (object scraping).
- Experience building reliable document downloading capabilities within scraping workflows.
- Solid understanding of web fundamentals: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6+), DOM manipulation, browser developer tools, HTTP/S protocols.
- Familiarity with common anti-scraping techniques (IP rotation, user-agent spoofing, fingerprinting, etc.) and strategies to mitigate them.
- Experience with Postgresql database management, including schema design, query optimization, and  modeling.
- Proficiency in Drizzle (ORM) for interacting with Postgresql databases, including defining models, performing queries, and managing transactions.
- Experience with version control systems, particularly Git.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.
- Excellent communication skills.

job_title: Detail-oriented annotators needed for an open-source intelligent web assistant project
job_description:
Note: we will begin reviewing proposals the week of March 10th, 2025, at which time you can expect to hear from the team. 

We are researchers with the Multimodal team at Ai2, a non-profit AI research institute. Our team is responsible for groundbreaking work such as Objaverse, Molmo and more. We are looking to hire at least 5 motivated, detail-oriented, tech-savvy annotators for a -collecting and -entry task to support an open-source intelligent web assistant development and research project.  

Participants will be provided with research accounts and will be tasked with navigating the web and taking dynamic actions on a diverse set of websites including creating research accounts and logging into a variety of platforms where actions such as shopping, searching, booking and more may take place. These actions will be captured via screen recordings and keyboard and mouse inputs for the purpose of training a web assistant that can help users with everyday web browsing activities similar to Google’s Mariner, or OpenAI’s Operator (users will NOT be recorded at any point). Participants will also  be asked to review the captured recordings and generated summaries of the actions taken to ensure accuracy and add any additional details or context as needed. Participants will be provided the necessary information to complete these research tasks and are required NOT to use their personal information.

Ideal candidates will be technically savvy with experience using a variety of technologies and applications including web extensions and note taking apps. Prior experience with similar  collection work and annotation tasks is highly desirable. A solid internet connection is required for this task. (candidates must be 18 years of age or older)

We estimate that this project will take approximately 30 - 40 hours a week over the course of about two months. This estimate includes one hour for reading the guidelines and completing a paid screening task, which will be used to evaluate your work quality and decide whether to extend the contract beyond the screening task, to the ~2 month contract. This project can be completed fully remotely.

Upon confirming the engagement, you will be asked to sign Ai2’s Upwork Project Agreement outlining the terms and conditions of your participation in this project.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Credit Analyst
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Credit Analysts or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

job_title: Entry, Web Research
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
Looking to pull Email addresses from small business. 

Collect from Ashwaubenon, WI 
This is a smaller area that is part of Green Bay, WI 
Lots of contractors service the area even though they are not near by, also nearby businesses in the greater area will be okay if you run out of emails to pull from Ashwaubenon. 

Find the email for the business, if you can't skip it as this is the most important piece of info. 

Name - Find the first name(s) of the business owner. Include both names of partners - especially husband and wife teams. More than likely the wife is opening the mail! Some places to grab the name are the “About Us” “Our Team” section of the website. Angie’s List is now free and displays the name of the business owner. Of course, manta is a great resource for the owner’s name. The last option is to google, “business name owner.” Some cities have community papers that cover the opening of every new business- owner profile included.
Company - Jot down the name of the business. Leave out the entity info like “Co.” and “LLC” etc. Also drop the extra description the average person would not naturally say in conversation. For example, do not type “Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Drain Service,” write “Roto-Rooter”
Business Type - Notate the company’s main industry or business category.
Description - Write 3-5 words expressing the main qualities of the business's product or services. You don’t have to re-invent the wheel here. A lot of time is spent coming up with a vision for their companies. They know exactly how they want to be perceived by the public. Use their own glowing words from the “About” section of their website or Facebook page. This info will show you know the business and serves as a little under cover sucking up. Pick adjectives that present the business in a positive light. Even if they notice you are parroting their copy, they will also recognize you are familiar with their business and more importantly -their branding. Leave blank if you can't find something to use.
 
Reason - Determine a sensible reason they should participate. Again, check out their website. See what ties they mention having to the neighborhood. Do they mention living or in the area or proudly serving the community for X amount of years? It could be as simple as they have a special offer displayed

Example of how this comes together:

Since you @Reason, we thought @Company might want to feature your @Description to the community.

Since you serve the area, we thought you might want to feature your business to the community

Ideas on where to look:

Neighborhood association website (event sponsors and newsletter ads)

Ideal Candidate

	•	Expertise in  visualization & dashboard creation for business intelligence reporting.
	•	Experience working with structured datasets (preferably in PostgreSQL).

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Quality Control Systems Manager
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Quality Control Systems Managers or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Payroll and Timekeeping Clerk
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in learning how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as payroll and Timekeeping Clerk or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

job_title: Azure AI & Power Automate LinkedIn Video Summarizer and LinkedIN Post Generator
job_description:
### **Part I: Content Download and Upload Facilitation**

**Objective:**

This part is designed to gather and analyze textual content from various sources, including LinkedIn and Medium, to determine the user’s distinct writing style. This system provides foundational analytics that help in enhancing personal and professional engagement through targeted content recommendations.

**Features:**

1. **Multi-Source Integration:**
    - **Automated and Manual Content Retrieval:** Depending on the platform’s API constraints, the system either automatically retrieves content or guides users to manually upload their posts. For LinkedIn and Medium, where direct access might be limited, the platform will include comprehensive guides on how to export posts. This feature ensures that all relevant content, whether accessible via API or through manual uploads, is captured and analyzed.
2. **Advanced Text Analysis for Writing Style Insights:**
    - **In-depth Content Evaluation:** Utilizing Azure Cognitive Services, this feature performs a thorough analysis of the text to extract sentiment, key phrases, and stylistic elements. By evaluating these elements, the platform can pinpoint characteristic patterns and suggest modifications to enhance readability and engagement. It also assesses the emotional tone and structural aspects of the writing to provide detailed feedback on how these elements influence reader engagement.
3. **User Interaction and  Handling:**
    - **Interactive User Dashboard:** Built with Power Apps, this dashboard allows users to upload or schedule content to LinkedIn, view detailed analyses, and receive personalized writing advice. The dashboard is designed to be user-friendly, catering to both tech-savvy users and those with minimal technical background.
    - **Secure  Management:** Ensures that all user  is handled securely, with robust encryption and compliance measures in place. Azure Blob Storage is used for  storage, providing a secure and scalable solution for managing large volumes of .
4. **Scalable and Accessible Platform Design:**
    - **Flexible Cloud Architecture:** The platform is built on Azure, providing high scalability to handle varying loads from individual users to large corporations. This scalability ensures that as user demand increases, the system can dynamically adjust resources without compromising performance.
    - **Accessibility and Inclusion:** Special attention is given to making the platform accessible, incorporating features like screen reader support, alternative text, and keyboard navigation options to ensure that all users can efficiently use the application.

### **Part II: Video Processing and Content Generation**

**Objective:**

This section handles video content processing and leverages both textual and visual insights to generate new, engaging content ideas. It integrates with the insights derived from the writing style analysis to offer a comprehensive content strategy tool.

**Features:**

1. **Dropbox Integration for Video Management:**
    - **Efficient File Transfer Protocol:** Monitors locally produced OBS video files and transfers them from Dropbox to Azure Blob Storage based on predefined conditions, such as file age and type, ensuring that the files are completely uploaded and closed before they are processed.
2. **Comprehensive Video Content Analysis:**
    - **Dual-component Processing:** Utilizes Azure Media Services to separate audio and visual components of video files. This separation allows for targeted analysis where audio is transcribed and visual elements are scanned using OCR, enabling a thorough understanding of the content presented in the videos.
3. **Dynamic Content Generation Based on Analyzed :**
    - **Intelligent Topic Generation:** The system uses Azure AI to analyze combined textual and video content insights to suggest new content topics. This feature aims to innovate content creation by providing users with -driven topic suggestions that are likely to engage their specific audience.
    - **Automated Content Drafting:** Employs advanced natural language generation techniques to create drafts that align with the user’s preferred style and the newly identified topics, ensuring content is both original and engaging.

### **Enhanced LinkedIn Analytics**

**Objective:**

To employ advanced analytics to learn from historical engagement  on LinkedIn posts, providing actionable insights that users can leverage to enhance their content strategy.

**Features:**

1. **Engagement Analysis Module:**
    - **Learning Algorithm:** Implements machine learning models that analyze past engagement metrics such as likes, shares, comments, and the reach of posts. By correlating these metrics with content features (e.g., post timing, hashtags, content length), the system identifies what factors most significantly impact engagement.
    - **Recommendation Engine:** Based on the analysis, the platform provides specific recommendations for improving post performance. These recommendations might include optimal posting times, suggested hashtags, or changes in content length and style to better resonate with the audience.
