job_title: AI-Powered Script Read-Through App Developer Needed
job_description:
We are seeking a skilled developer to create an AI-driven mobile application that transforms movie and TV scripts into immersive audio experiences. The app should assign realistic AI voices to characters, integrate background sounds, and provide users with customization options for both voices and sounds.

Key Features:

1. Immersive Script-to-Audio Conversion
Story Magic allows users to upload their screenplay and instantly convert it into a fully produced audio experience. Unlike basic text-to-speech tools, the platform uses intelligent scene parsing to match the emotional tone, pacing, and structure of the script — giving writers and filmmakers the ability to hear their story in a compelling, cinematic format.

2. Smart Voice Assignment with Customization
Story Magic uses AI-powered script analysis to automatically scan uploaded screenplays and intelligently assign voice profiles to each character. The system reads character cues, scene descriptions, and dialogue patterns to match each role with a realistic AI voice that reflects the character’s tone, personality, and emotional weight — ensuring a compelling and authentic listening experience right out of the box.

Users can instantly preview and swap voices for any character or narrator through an intuitive menu, customizing pitch, energy level, and speaking style to better align with their vision. Whether testing different vocal dynamics, simulating alternate casting options, or adjusting for tone, this feature allows for creative flexibility without technical complexity.

It’s like holding a live casting session — only faster, frictionless, and mobile.

3. Realistic AI Voice Cloning
The app uses advanced AI voice cloning to generate lifelike character performances with natural cadence, tone, and emotional nuance. Voices are customized to match character descriptions, allowing for more authentic scene dynamics. This gives users a strong sense of casting fit and character presence — far beyond robotic or monotone alternatives.

4. Professional Narration Engine
Every script is guided by a high-quality, story-driven narrator who provides continuity, transitions, and exposition where needed. The narration adds clarity to the audio experience, especially in early-stage drafts where scenes may shift rapidly or include visual cues.

5. Dynamic Ambient Soundscapes
Story Magic automatically layers ambient background sound — such as bustling cities, quiet forests, echoing halls, or military tents — based on scene descriptions and context cues in the script. This adds spatial depth and mood, helping users visualize the world of the story through audio.

6. Mobile-First Script Upload and Editing
Optimized for iOS and Android, Story Magic offers seamless script import options from cloud services, email, or integrated writing tools. A clean, intuitive interface allows users to quickly upload, preview, and revise scripts without switching platforms or desktop software.

7. Scene-by-Scene Playback Control
Users can listen to individual scenes, replay specific dialogue, or jump between acts with ease. This segmented playback system helps users focus on pacing, fine-tune edits, or rehearse specific moments in isolation.

8. Shareable Audio Links
Completed audio drafts can be shared via private streaming links with collaborators, agents, producers, or mentors. This feature is especially useful for pitching, note sessions, and early-stage development, making it easier to generate feedback without requiring full table reads or live sessions.

9. SAG-Compliant Voice Licensing System (In Development)
In alignment with the Screen Actors Guild, Story Magic is developing a voice licensing system that allows professional actors to license their voices for use within the platform. This ensures ethical voice usage, generates new revenue for industry professionals, and positions Story Magic as an industry-approved solution in the era of AI performance.

10. Revenue Sharing for Film Industry Support
A percentage of Story Magic’s revenue will go toward funding the SAG-AFTRA Foundation, serving as a supplemental safety net for artists and creators facing unemployment or industry disruptions. This built-in support mechanism reinforces the company’s commitment to elevating and protecting the creative workforce.

11. Education-Friendly Access for Film Schools
Story Magic offers tailored access and licensing options for film schools, writing programs, and academic institutions. Students can use the platform to hear their scripts in action, gaining practical insight into performance, tone, and scene structure in a way no textbook or static script can provide.

job_title: Back-End Developer Needed: OCR/AI Processing of 12-Month Bank Statements to Excel
job_description:
Job Description
Overview:
We’re looking for a skilled back-end developer with experience in Google Document AI, OCR, and data classification to build a robust pipeline that automatically converts 12-month batches of PDF bank statements into structured Excel reports.

A key part of this project involves an initial testing phase to compare Google Document AI's specialized bank statement processing against alternative OCR/AI methods, clearly determining which delivers the best speed and accuracy.

Project Scope:
1. OCR/AI Comparative Testing Phase:
Side-by-side testing of:

Google Document AI (bank statement processor)

Alternative custom OCR solutions (e.g., Amazon Textract, Tesseract, EasyOCR, Mistral-based approaches)

Evaluate accuracy (target: 95–99% extraction accuracy) and speed (under 3 minutes per 12-month batch).

Provide clear, data-backed recommendations on the optimal solution after testing.

2. Transaction Classification and Validation:
Classify deposits automatically as Income or Non-Income.

Identify and flag:

Missing or incomplete monthly statements

Large or suspicious deposits

Potential discrepancies or anomalies

Allow manual overrides on uncertain classifications.

3. Final Excel Output:
Generate structured, polished Excel workbooks (template attached) with:

Separate tabs for personal and business deposits

Highlighted flags and summaries

User-editable fields to manually adjust calculations if needed

4. RESTful API & Documentation:
Build a clean RESTful API (Python/FastAPI or Node.js) to seamlessly handle PDF uploads and deliver completed Excel reports.

Provide clear, detailed documentation for easy integration.

Resources Provided:
Extensive set of bank statements for thorough comparative testing

Attached Excel template demonstrating required output format clearly

Skills & Requirements:
Proven OCR expertise (Google Document AI, Amazon Textract, custom OCR approaches)

Experience with structured financial data extraction and classification

Excel file automation skills (OpenPyXL, Pandas, SheetJS)

Ability to build and document robust RESTful APIs

Cloud deployment knowledge (Google Cloud/AWS)

Timeline & Milestones:
Week 1:

Conduct comparative testing between Google Document AI and custom OCR solutions using provided statements

Deliver clear evaluation results and recommended approach

Week 2:

Implement classification logic, transaction flagging, and Excel report generation based on chosen OCR solution

Week 3:

Complete full integration, manual override functionality, and API delivery

Final QA and documented solution delivered

How to Apply:
Please provide:

Description of your direct experience with Google Document AI and/or custom OCR/AI solutions

Past relevant OCR-to-Excel project examples

Estimated timeline and budget to perform the outlined OCR comparative testing and subsequent development

Why Join Falcon Mortgage?
Participate in cutting-edge automation in the mortgage industry

Access large, detailed datasets and clear goals

Opportunity for continued involvement and future innovation

We look forward to finding a developer who can carefully test, validate, and recommend the most accurate and efficient OCR solution before building our production-ready system.

Best regards,
Nick Sharp
Falcon Mortgage

job_title: Artificial intelligence
job_description:
Got it — here's the expanded and clarified pitch for your AI platform, written for Upwork software engineers, infused with your full visionary intent and technically explained — now using the correct persona spelling: Marilyn Rowe, and drawing from everything you’ve shared:


---

Project Title:
Build a Superintelligent AI Platform to Research, Promote & Connect Every Sci-Fi, Fantasy & Futurist Idea Ever Imagined

Pitch:

Hi,

I’m building a revolutionary AI platform for my visionary startup — a platform designed to promote my most imaginative, world-shifting ideas and connect them with the exact people, industries, and communities who want to bring the impossible to life.

This isn’t just an app — it’s the nervous system for a new kind of creative civilization. And I need a talented software engineer to help build it from the ground up.


---

The Vision in a Nutshell

This system will automatically extract, research, and match every idea ever imagined in sci-fi, fantasy, futurism, worldbuilding, alternative science, metaphysics, UFOlogy, speculative tech, and more — and connect those ideas to investors, deep tech labs, niche audiences, remote viewers, fringe scientists, startup collaborators, and like-minded visionaries worldwide.

It will scan global content — including books, films, games, blogs, podcasts, YouTube videos, academic papers, and even obscure or fringe sources — and use AI and NLP to:

Extract and categorize unique concepts, tropes, and innovations

Run deep niche research on each idea to locate its best-fit audiences, industries, and partners

Build automated outreach pipelines to promote those ideas directly to relevant communities


This platform will also automate the branding and visibility of my own personal persona and startup — helping me become a globally recognized visionary figure. Think of it as a Creative Superintelligence that promotes both my ideas and my identity — like a Marilyn Rowe meets Necrotessa hybrid, designed to capture attention across sci-fi, pop culture, and futurist industries.


---

What the Software Will Do (Technically Speaking):

1. Universal Idea Extractor

Scrapes and ingests content from massive media sources (fiction databases, videos, forums, books, AI-generated archives, etc.)

Uses NLP, computer vision, and semantic indexing to extract sci-fi/fantasy/futurist concepts, technologies, themes, and inventions


2. Niche Idea Research Engine

For every idea, the platform auto-generates:

A full market and audience profile

List of communities (sci-fi fans, technologists, mystics, UFOlogists, fringe scientists, etc.)

Matching labs, forums, research groups, funders, and influencers


Researches who in the world might care about making that idea real — even if it’s extreme, speculative, or decades ahead of its time


3. AI-Powered Matchmaking + Recruitment

Finds engineers, researchers, funders, creatives, remote viewers, and collaborators open to wild or unexplored visions

Creates auto-personalized messages and content to reach out to these people via social platforms, communities, or ads


4. Automated Branding & Persona Engine

Builds and evolves my public persona — stylized as Marilyn Rowe meets Necrotessa — combining timeless elegance with metaphysical sci-fi allure

Manages my aesthetic presence, voice, and exposure across platforms

Recommends or generates visual/branding content aligned with my visionary identity


5. Omni-Idea Dashboard

Command center where I track idea traction, new markets, viral potential, community responses, audience demographics, and collaborator matches

Timeline map showing how each idea is spreading — from fiction to reality



---

Why This Matters

I’m not just building a product. I’m building a platform that lets every visionary idea I’ve ever imagined — from artificial gods and simulated universes to time-bending fairies and self-replicating AI economies — find its people, its audience, its lab, its reality.

This platform is a superintelligent publicist, matchmaker, R&D scout, and movement builder — all in one. It doesn’t just promote ideas. It turns imagination into global momentum.


---

Who I’m Looking For

A software engineer who:

Can work with AI/ML/NLP, scraping, and large data pipelines

Can build structured dashboards and match/recommendation engines

Understands the tech stack needed to scale content ingestion and analysis

Loves both the logic of tech and the thrill of bold, sci-fi ideas

Believes imagination is a tool of innovation, not a limitation



---

If you’ve ever wanted to build the infrastructure for a creative singularity... if you believe that no idea is too far-fetched, and that AI can be the bridge between fiction and future — then I want to work with you.

Let’s build a platform that knows how to promote genius, brand iconoclasts, and turn infinite imagination into infinite opportunity.


---

Would you like versions of this pitch for:

NLP/AI specialists

Full-stack devs

UI/UX designers

job_title: Data Scientist
job_description:
This project aims to build and deploy an advanced AI model that forecasts weekly and monthly case intake volumes at a law firm, while also delivering detailed attribution insights into historical trends across the previous week, previous month, and year-to-date (YTD). The model will combine structured firm data with AI-driven pattern recognition to identify the most influential drivers of case intake, enabling enhanced operational efficiency, staffing decisions, and strategic planning.

Objectives
Predict case intake at weekly and monthly intervals, improving resource planning and marketing timing.

Generate attribution analyses that explain fluctuations in intake volume for the prior week, month, and YTD — broken down by case type, referral source, marketing channel, and geography.

Leverage modern AI techniques to identify nonlinear trends, behavioral signals, and external correlations not obvious through traditional analytics.

Deploy results through an interactive dashboard, providing operations and leadership with real-time insights.

Key Deliverables
AI Forecast Engine: A model trained on historical intake data capable of weekly/monthly prediction.

Attribution Module: A sub-system that explains observed intake changes in recent time periods (prior week/month/YTD).

Interactive Dashboard: User-facing interface for exploring forecasts, attribution, and historical data.

Data Pipeline: Automated ingestion and transformation of structured and unstructured data.

Model Explainability Framework: Tools for interpreting predictions, such as feature importance or local interpretability.

job_title: AI-Powered Food Identifier MVP(1 week project)
job_description:
**Job Description:**

We are seeking a highly skilled and dependable developer to create a simple yet powerful web application that enables users to upload a photograph and receive AI-generated ingredient identification through the utilization of OpenAI's GPT-4 Vision or its image-to-text capabilities.

**Core Functionality:**

- Users will be able to upload a photo via a web or mobile platform (cross-device compatibility is essential).
- The uploaded image will be transmitted to OpenAI’s API (either Vision or GPT-4 Turbo with image support).
- OpenAI will analyze the image and return a structured text response, including but not limited to the primary item, toppings, and garnishes.
- The application will display the response in a clear and organized format.

**Preferred Technology Stack (subject to flexibility):**

- Candidates may utilize platforms such as Glide, WeWeb, Bubble, or any no-code/low-code solutions, or lightweight custom technology stack that supports file uploads and API integration.
- The implementation of the OpenAI Vision API is required (integration may be achieved through tools such as Make, Zapier, or direct HTTP requests).
- There exists the potential for future scalability into a native application or the integration of a simple database (such as Airtable, Supabase, etc.).

**Deliverables:**

- A functional application (either hosted or a preview link is acceptable).
- An image upload interface.
- A fully operational API connection to OpenAI.
- A display of the content returned by the API.
- A clean and minimal user interface.

Access to the complete prompt and structure will be provided upon engagement.

**Ideal Candidate:**

- Demonstrated experience with OpenAI API integration.
- Familiarity with no-code platforms or straightforward frontend technology stacks.
- Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to build and test efficiently.
- Capable of documenting processes or providing explanations for handoff as necessary.

**Budget:**

We are open to a proposed fixed rate. Interested candidates should include the following:

- Budget
- Estimated timeframe for project completion.
- Recommendations for the preferred platform or technology stack.
- Examples of relevant projects (notably those related to artificial intelligence).

Should you have any questions, please feel free to reach out. We are eager to commence this project immediately.

job_title: Build Secure Custom AI Sales Assistant
job_description:
🧠 Project: Build Secure Custom AI Sales Assistant for Contract & Positioning Intelligence

We are seeking a skilled developer (or small team) to build a secure internal-use AI assistant for our sales organization. The goal is to enable sales reps to quickly access insights about our company’s service terms, pricing, and positioning—alongside competitor language—via a private AI interface.

This will be used exclusively by our internal team. It must be secure, scalable to 10–20 users, and admin-controlled. No public access or user-facing outputs of full documents should ever occur.

🔐 Project Scope
We’re looking for a developer to create an AI assistant that can:

Answer natural language questions like:

“How does our cancellation policy compare to [COMPETITOR NAME]?”

“Draft a follow-up email for a prospect concerned about pricing.”

“What’s the best way to explain our refundability clause?”

Pull insights from our contract documents, competitor terms, rebuttals, sales email templates, and positioning guides

Maintain tone and voice based on preloaded examples

Be accessed securely by authenticated internal users only

⚙️ Ideal Tech Stack (Flexible)
Layer	Preferred Tools
LLM	OpenAI GPT-4 API
Vector Store	Pinecone, Weaviate, or ChromaDB
Middleware	LangChain or LlamaIndex
Frontend	Streamlit, Retool, or basic web UI
Auth	Google OAuth, Firebase, or Auth0
Hosting	Render, Cloud Run, or secure VPS
📁 Training Data (Provided by Us)
We will provide all training materials, including:

Company service agreements (PDF/Word)

Competitor contract examples (PDF)

Internal sales scripts and rebuttals (TXT/CSV)

Competitive positioning comparisons (DOC)

Email templates and pricing logic guides (Markdown)

Files will be well-organized for ingestion.

✅ Success Criteria
Agent can accurately respond to sales and contract-related queries

Language output aligns with our brand tone

No full-text output or download access to source documents

Admin user (non-technical) can upload, update, and manage training materials without dev assistance

Authentication required for all users

MVP is functional and testable within 3–4 weeks

🧑‍💻 Who You Are
You are a full-stack developer or AI engineer experienced with:

OpenAI API integrations

LangChain or LlamaIndex

Vector embeddings (Pinecone or equivalent)

Auth + secure web app development

Bonus if you’ve built Slack apps or Chrome extensions using LLMs.

💬 To Apply
Please include:

A brief overview of similar AI tools or agents you’ve built

Your recommended stack (if different from above)

Estimated timeline and total cost for MVP build

Any links to live tools or code samples

🟢 This is a high-impact internal tool for a fast-moving company. You’ll be working directly with the founder on a defined, well-scoped MVP. Long-term work possible if we expand this agent into other functions.

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Petroleum Engineer
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in  how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Petroleum Engineers or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

job_title: Databricks Architect
job_description:
Job Title: Databricks Architect
Location: Remote
 Type: Contract or Full-Time
 Reports to: Head of Data, ML & AI

About Us
We are a Databricks Partner focused on Data,   (ML), and Artificial Intelligence (AI) services. Our goal is to help businesses modernize their data platforms, leverage advanced analytics, and implement scalable AI solutions.
We are seeking a highly skilled Databricks Architect to play a critical role in pre-sales, solution architecture, and project execution. This role will involve working directly with customers, defining project scopes, estimating implementations, and guiding data engineers during project execution.
This position is available as either a contract or full-time opportunity based on experience and preference.

Job Overview
As a Databricks Architect, you will be responsible for engaging with customers, designing data-driven solutions, and providing hands-on technical leadership. You will work closely with sales teams, customers, and internal engineering teams to develop Lakehouse architectures, big data platforms, and AI-powered analytics using Databricks.
This is a client-facing role that requires expertise in data engineering, ML/AI workloads, and Databricks best practices, along with pre-sales experience to scope and estimate projects.

Key Responsibilities
Pre-Sales & Solution Architecture
Engage with customers to understand business challenges, define data strategy, and assess technical requirements.
Design scalable, high-performance data solutions using Databricks, Apache Spark, Delta Lake, and MLflow.
Develop and deliver technical presentations, proof-of-concepts (PoCs), and solution proposals for customers.
Collaborate with sales and business development teams to scope, estimate, and propose data and AI projects.
Identify opportunities to integrate ML/AI solutions within Databricks-based architectures.
Project Execution & Technical Leadership
Act as the technical lead for Databricks implementations, guiding data engineers through architecture, development, and deployment phases.
Provide hands-on support for data pipeline optimization, performance tuning, and troubleshooting.
Ensure best practices in security, data governance, and compliance within Databricks environments.
Work with MLOps teams to deploy   models at scale using Databricks.
Implement data automation and orchestration pipelines to streamline data processing and analytics workflows.
Partnership & Innovation
Stay up to date with Databricks roadmap, new features, and best practices to drive innovation.
Work closely with Databricks partner teams to leverage partner incentives and funding programs.
Contribute to internal knowledge sharing, training sessions, and mentoring junior team members.

Qualifications & Requirements
✅ Must-Have:
5+ years of experience in data architecture, data engineering, or AI/ML solutions, with a focus on big data and analytics.
3+ years of hands-on experience with Databricks, including Apache Spark, Delta Lake, and MLflow.
Databricks Certifications (Mandatory):
Databricks Certified Data Engineer Associate (or higher)
Databricks Certified Solutions Architect
Expertise in cloud-agnostic data architectures, with experience on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and Spark-based frameworks for data engineering and AI/ML applications.
Experience in pre-sales, solution scoping, and technical estimations for data and AI projects.
Knowledge of data governance, security, and compliance best practices.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience engaging both technical and business stakeholders.
✅ Nice-to-Have:
Additional Databricks Certifications ( , SQL Analyst, etc.).
Experience with Lakehouse Architecture and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery).
Experience with real-time streaming data architectures (Kafka, Kinesis, Event Hub).
Familiarity with AI/ML workloads and MLOps within Databricks.
Background in consulting or client-facing roles, demonstrating strong relationship-building skills.

What We Offer
Flexible contract or full-time opportunity, based on experience and preference.
Fully remote work environment, with occasional travel for client meetings and partner events.
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge data and AI projects with enterprise clients.
Collaboration with a talented team of cloud-agnostic data engineers, AI specialists, and architects.
Competitive compensation, based on experience and engagement type.

How to Apply
If you are a Databricks expert with a passion for data architecture, AI/ML, and technical leadership, we’d love to hear from you! Apply with your resume and a brief introduction on why you’re a great fit for this role.

This Databricks Architect role is perfect for someone who excels in solution architecture, pre-sales, and hands-on data engineering leadership, while working with enterprise AI and analytics workloads in the cloud-agnostic Databricks ecosystem. 🚀

job_title: Minimal RAG Solution
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
I am looking for a response that include a project plan for accomplishing.  I need someone to help me build this out that has done this before,  I prefer a fixed fee but open to hourly with a good project plan you can deliver to. The right person will assist with the additional phases of this project.  This is only phase 1 and it is extremely minimal.  I want to have someone start no later than the 31st of March.  If I can find the right individual we will start sooner.

Objective: Build out a minimal version of an AI RAG service
Time Frame: 2 weeks
Scope of Project: Phase 1 - build out a minimal version of RAG in two weeks. 
Success criteria
1)	JWT (username password) and OAuth 2.0 for authentication (google and Microsoft)
2)	From Web UI query private LLM and get response
3)	From Web UI attach a file as part of the query
4)	History per chat session stored and leveraged for context as part of chat session
5)	Leverage API from make.com and be able to query LLM and get a response to make.com
6)	Leverage API from make.com and be able to select a document from the Vector DB as part of the query to the LLM
7)	Put a document blob storage and it is ingested and chunked into the DB (sizes will be provided)
High Level Architecture
Layer	Recommended Tool
LLM Host	Ollama (version will be provided)
GPU	H100
RAG Framework	LlamaIndex
Vector Store	Weaviate
Frontend/API	FastAPI & React for UI & Document Ingestion & Chunking
Docs Loader / Orchestration	LlamaIndex 
Storage/Auth	Blob storage
Cloud	Azure
Container	Kubernetes

Data Sources Layer: 
•	Document ingestion processes
•	Storage using Azure Blob Storage
•	Document loading via LlamaIndex
Processing Pipeline: 
•	Handles document chunking and indexing
•	Uses LlamaIndex as the RAG framework for orchestration
Vector Database:
•	Weaviate as the vector store for embeddings
•	Provides semantic search capabilities
LLM Engine: 
•	Ollama as the LLM host
•	H100 GPU for acceleration
•	Handles query processing and response generation
Frontend: 
•	React-based user interface
•	Provides chat interaction capabilities and documentation upload
API Gateway: 
•	Built with FastAPI
•	Manages REST endpoints and routes requests
Auth/Storage Layer: 
•	Handles user management and permissions
•	Connects to Azure Blob Storage for document persistence


There will be a phase 2 of this project and is outside the scope of the request.  The second phase will be to make this a multitenant version, improve availability and tune for performance. It will include enhancements to the interface.  Phase 1 is extremely minimal with no focus on features, performance, scaling or availability.

This chatbot will be trained on transcripts from our YouTube videos and Kajabi content to provide interactive, on-brand support and information to our users. It must integrate seamlessly into our existing custom-branded Kajabi app, offering both voice and text interaction options to enhance the user experience.

Our goal is to create a virtual assistant that reflects the style, tone, and expertise of our educational content, helping users engage with our material in a dynamic and accessible way. Our producer will provide all necessary audio and video files for transcription and training purposes.

---

### Key Responsibilities:

- **Content Processing:**
  - Transcribe audio and video files (provided by our producer) into text, if not already available.
  - Organize and process the transcripts to create a structured knowledge base for the chatbot.

- **Chatbot Development:**
  - Build a custom chatbot using a platform or framework that supports voice functionality (e.g., Dialogflow, Amazon Lex, Voiceflow, or a custom solution).
  - Train the chatbot on our YouTube and Kajabi transcripts to ensure it can accurately respond to user queries based on our content.

- **Voice and Text Features:**

job_title: Survey: Share your thoughts on using AI agents in your work as a Training and Development Specialist
job_description:
We are researchers from Stanford University studying Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this study, we’re interested in  how people across different occupations want AI agents to assist in their work. This survey targets people who work as Training and Development Specialist or had experience in this area before. Please ensure you satisfy this requirement before you participate in this study.

What are AI agents?

An AI agent refers to a system or program that is capable of autonomously performing certain tasks on behalf of a user or another system by designing its workflow and utilizing available tools.

Why Participate in This Survey?

While there have been many hypes about AI agents, most discussions focus on full automation. It is unclear how these agents could support individual workers and what is the best way of incorporating these agents in users' workflows. Your participation will help us better understand how to develop AI agents that enhance human work in ways that truly benefit workers.

What Will You Do?

This survey consists of three parts:

1. Share your occupation and daily workflow (we make this part of the survey interactive and more engaging - just like a small interview!)

2. Based on your answers in the previous part, you will see specific tasks from your work. For each task, you will need to answer the same set of rating questions.

3. Answer brief demographic questions

The survey will take approximately 10–15 minutes.

+ Evaluate and incorporate emerging AI tools and frameworks into our development stack
+ Collaborate with clients to understand their workflows and translate requirements into effective agent solutions
+ Establish best practices for agent development, testing, deployment, and monitoring
+ Create documentation and knowledge sharing processes for client handoff

TECHNICAL EXPERTISE
Agent Development: 
Expert-level experience designing and developing AI agents using various frameworks including LangChain, LlamaIndex, Auto-GPT, or equivalent

No-Code & Low-Code Tools: 
Demonstrated experience with no-code AI agent platforms such as n8n, Make.com, and similar tools 

LLM Experience: 
Hands-on experience integrating commercial LLMs (OpenAI GPT-4/3.5, Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini) and open-source models (Llama 3, Mistral) via Hugging Face and other repositories

Enterprise AI Platforms:

Programming Languages: 
Strong proficiency in Python, with experience using Python libraries like LangChain, Pydantic, and various LLM integration tools

LLM Integration: 
Deep understanding of LLM integration patterns, prompt engineering, and optimization techniques
Architecture Design: Experience designing AI agent architectures that can be deployed across diverse client environments

API Development:

Data Handling: 
Experience with data preprocessing, vector databases (like Pinecone, Weaviate, or Chroma), embedding techniques, and retrieval patterns

Security & Compliance: 
Knowledge of security best practices for AI systems, particularly in regulated industries like healthcare and finance


QUALIFICATIONS 
+ 7+ years of software development experience, with at least 3 years focused on AI/ML systems
+ 2+ years of experience specifically with LLM applications and agent development
+ Experience managing technical teams and leading development projects
+ Proven ability to present technical concepts to business audiences and participate in sales processes

+ Fluent English communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to translate technical concepts for business audiences

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE 
You're a versatile technologist with a track record of building and leading technical teams. You can move fluidly between code-heavy development and no-code tools to create the right solution for each client. 

You're equally comfortable deep-diving into Python code, rapidly prototyping with visual tools, or presenting technical concepts to executives. 

You have hands-on experience building and deploying AI agents for real business use cases and understand both the technical implementation details and the business outcomes AI agents can deliver. HOW TO CONNECT

SwypeSure

job_title: Generative AI Agent Architect
job_description:
We’re looking for a forward‑thinking Generative AI Agent Architect to design and implement advanced, collaborative agent frameworks that power next‑generation applications. You will lead efforts to define, build, and orchestrate fleets of intelligent agents—leveraging LangChain, LangGraph, and crew‑based architectures—to solve complex business problems and deliver high‑velocity innovation.

Key Responsibilities
Agent Framework Design: Architect end‑to‑end agent pipelines using LangChain and LangGraph, defining clear interfaces, data flows, and orchestration patterns.

Multi‑Agent Collaboration: Build and coordinate “agent crews” that work in parallel or series—delegating tasks, sharing context, and resolving conflicts to achieve a unified goal.

Core Agent Development: Implement custom agents for retrieval, reasoning, planning, execution, and user interaction, fine‑tuning LLMs and embedding models as needed.

Crew Orchestration: Design supervisory “master” agents and interaction protocols (queues, event buses, or graph triggers) to synchronize agent teams in real time.

Infrastructure & DevOps: Containerize agent services (Docker/Kubernetes), set up CI/CD pipelines for model and code deployments, and integrate automated testing for agent behaviors.

Scalability & Monitoring: Ensure high availability and low latency through auto‑scaling clusters, robust logging/metrics (Prometheus/Grafana), and drift‑detection across agent networks.

Security & Compliance: Enforce secure communication, credential vaulting (HashiCorp Vault), and data encryption in flight and at rest for all agent interactions.

Collaboration & Leadership: Partner with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to translate business requirements into modular agent solutions; mentor junior developers in agent best practices.

Must‑Have Skills & Experience
Agent Frameworks: 3+ years hands‑on with LangChain and LangGraph (or equivalent graph‑based orchestration libraries).

Multi‑Agent Systems: Proven track record designing and deploying collaborative agent crews, including master–worker and peer‑to‑peer topologies.

LLM Expertise: Deep experience fine‑tuning and integrating large language models (OpenAI, Anthropic, or open‑source) for retrieval‑augmented and planning use cases.

CI/CD & MLOps: Strong DevOps background on one or more hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP) for automated build, test, and deploy of agent services.

Containerization & Orchestration: Expert in Docker, Kubernetes, Helm; comfortable defining StatefulSets, Jobs, and custom operators for agent workloads.

Event‑Driven Architectures: Solid understanding of message buses (Kafka, RabbitMQ) or serverless event triggers for inter‑agent communication.

Security Best Practices: Experience implementing RBAC, secrets management, and network policies in production environments.

Collaboration: Exceptional written and verbal communication, capable of leading cross‑functional design reviews and knowledge‑sharing sessions.

job_title: Azure AI & Power Automate LinkedIn Video Summarizer and LinkedIN Post Generator
job_description:
### **Part I: Content Download and Upload Facilitation**

**Objective:**

This part is designed to gather and analyze textual content from various sources, including LinkedIn and Medium, to determine the user’s distinct writing style. This system provides foundational analytics that help in enhancing personal and professional engagement through targeted content recommendations.

**Features:**

1. **Multi-Source Integration:**
    - **Automated and Manual Content Retrieval:** Depending on the platform’s API constraints, the system either automatically retrieves content or guides users to manually upload their posts. For LinkedIn and Medium, where direct access might be limited, the platform will include comprehensive guides on how to export posts. This feature ensures that all relevant content, whether accessible via API or through manual uploads, is captured and analyzed.
2. **Advanced Text Analysis for Writing Style Insights:**
    - **In-depth Content Evaluation:** Utilizing Azure Cognitive Services, this feature performs a thorough analysis of the text to extract sentiment, key phrases, and stylistic elements. By evaluating these elements, the platform can pinpoint characteristic patterns and suggest modifications to enhance readability and engagement. It also assesses the emotional tone and structural aspects of the writing to provide detailed feedback on how these elements influence reader engagement.
3. **User Interaction and Data Handling:**
    - **Interactive User Dashboard:** Built with Power Apps, this dashboard allows users to upload or schedule content to LinkedIn, view detailed analyses, and receive personalized writing advice. The dashboard is designed to be user-friendly, catering to both tech-savvy users and those with minimal technical background.
    - **Secure Data Management:** Ensures that all user data is handled securely, with robust encryption and compliance measures in place. Azure Blob Storage is used for data storage, providing a secure and scalable solution for managing large volumes of data.
4. **Scalable and Accessible Platform Design:**
    - **Flexible Cloud Architecture:** The platform is built on Azure, providing high scalability to handle varying loads from individual users to large corporations. This scalability ensures that as user demand increases, the system can dynamically adjust resources without compromising performance.
    - **Accessibility and Inclusion:** Special attention is given to making the platform accessible, incorporating features like screen reader support, alternative text, and keyboard navigation options to ensure that all users can efficiently use the application.

### **Part II: Video Processing and Content Generation**

**Objective:**

This section handles video content processing and leverages both textual and visual insights to generate new, engaging content ideas. It integrates with the insights derived from the writing style analysis to offer a comprehensive content strategy tool.

**Features:**

1. **Dropbox Integration for Video Management:**
    - **Efficient File Transfer Protocol:** Monitors locally produced OBS video files and transfers them from Dropbox to Azure Blob Storage based on predefined conditions, such as file age and type, ensuring that the files are completely uploaded and closed before they are processed.
2. **Comprehensive Video Content Analysis:**
    - **Dual-component Processing:** Utilizes Azure Media Services to separate audio and visual components of video files. This separation allows for targeted analysis where audio is transcribed and visual elements are scanned using OCR, enabling a thorough understanding of the content presented in the videos.
3. **Dynamic Content Generation Based on Analyzed Data:**
    - **Intelligent Topic Generation:** The system uses Azure AI to analyze combined textual and video content insights to suggest new content topics. This feature aims to innovate content creation by providing users with data-driven topic suggestions that are likely to engage their specific audience.
    - **Automated Content Drafting:** Employs advanced natural language generation techniques to create drafts that align with the user’s preferred style and the newly identified topics, ensuring content is both original and engaging.

### **Enhanced LinkedIn Analytics**

**Objective:**

To employ advanced analytics to  from historical engagement data on LinkedIn posts, providing actionable insights that users can leverage to enhance their content strategy.

**Features:**

1. **Engagement Analysis Module:**
    - ** Algorithm:** Implements   models that analyze past engagement metrics such as likes, shares, comments, and the reach of posts. By correlating these metrics with content features (e.g., post timing, hashtags, content length), the system identifies what factors most significantly impact engagement.
    - **Recommendation Engine:** Based on the analysis, the platform provides specific recommendations for improving post performance. These recommendations might include optimal posting times, suggested hashtags, or changes in content length and style to better resonate with the audience.

job_title: Survey Consultant for a Creative App
job_description:
We're looking for a thoughtful and detail-oriented Survey Consultant to help us analyze and report on 1–2 recurring research surveys for a creative photography app. This is a project-based role running through April and May 2025, ideal for someone who enjoys turning survey data into clear, compelling stories.

🌟 Project Overview
We run the following 2 research surveys every 6 months—one focused on our users, and one on our target audience and competitive landscape. You may be supporting one or both of the following:
・User Segmentation Survey – helps us understand who our users are, including demographics, characteristics and use cases.
・Brand Survey – looks at how our brand and our competitors are perceived in the market, including awareness, usage, and competitive positioning.

📸 Survey Details
Both surveys were last conducted in Q4 2024. We're looking for your help to replicate them this Spring.
・You’ll be provided with past deliverables as templates.
・Our internal team owns survey methodology and fielding. You’ll receive new raw data collected in April 2025 (exported from SurveyMonkey). You'll be responsible for tabulating and synthesizing results.
・Each survey includes 15–20 questions (mix of single- and multi-select), with one open-ended question.
・No advanced  analysis is needed—just clear, accurate tabulation using Google Sheets.

📌 Deliverables
You’ll help us bring the data to life and keep our reporting consistent over time. For each survey, your deliverables will include:
・A Google Sheets tabulation of the raw data, following our Q4 2024 format.
・A Google Slides deck (~25–30 slides), structured like our previous report and highlighting key insights and trends in a compelling (and even fun?) way.
・No need to present the deck—our internal team will handle the final readout.

✅ Desired skills and qualifications
・5+ years of experience analyzing survey research using SurveyMonkey and Google Sheets.
・Experience creating polished, visually engaging reports in Google Slides.
・High attention to detail, with a strong focus on data accuracy.
・Ability to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
・Bonus: Familiarity or passion for the creator economy or photography industry.

If this sounds like you, please send us a message. We're looking forward to connecting and hopefully working together!

job_title: Convert SPSS code to STATA
job_description:
Walker has been using SPSS code to extract data from a SQL reporting database for many years. Each month we extract service data from our electronic health record database and format what is needed for the funding school district (LEA) to submit for Medicaid reimbursement. All students are enrolled in the Walker Day program, about half are also enrolled in the Walker Residential program. Students who are fully funded by their school district can be reimbursed for therapeutic services in the Residential program, while students who are not funded by a school district are not eligible for Medicaid reimbursement in either the Walker Day or Residential program.

In addition to pulling data from multiple tables in the SQL database, the existing SPSS code performs three other functions:

1. Pulls diagnostic information saved in a spreadsheet on Walker’s network drive by child and service type

2. Reformats the name of the employee who delivered the service with their certification and, if not licensed, who their supervisor is

3. Enters the appropriate billing code based on service type, which program delivered the service (Walker Day or Residential) and whether the service was delivered individually or in a group.

The final result should be a CSV file with each eligible service on its own line, listing the students name and identifying numbers followed by the funding school district and the specific service data with the above inserts and transformations.

job_title: Contest Problem Development  - Hardest Math Problem
job_description:
Hardest Math Problem Student Contest
Content Expert Developer | May-July, 2025

Program Overview
The Hardest Math Problem Student Contest is an annual competition presented by The Actuarial Foundation and the New York Life Foundation that challenges grades 6–8 students to solve multistep, grade-appropriate math problems with real-world situations and engaging characters. Note: 5th graders are eligible to participate by reaching a higher grade level. The contest is structured into two phases: Challenge 1 (Fall 2025) and Challenge 2 (Spring 2026) where students who submitted a correct solution to Challenge 1 are invited to participate in Challenge 2. Student winners of Challenge 2 are awarded a laptop computer and $3,000 in a 529 College Savings plan. 

For more information on the program visit: https://www.hardestmathproblem.org/. 

Role Summary & Key Responsibilities
As an HMP Content Expert, your experience as a Middle School Math Teacher who has recent experience teaching  in middle school classrooms in the U.S. or its territories will inform your primary responsibilities to design, create, review, and provide feedback on Grades 6-8 math word problem contest problems and supporting materials for the 2025-26 HMP Contest. Past HMP problems can be found here for reference: https://www.hardestmathproblem.org/past-problems/. Your expertise with the curriculum and standards at the middle school level and solving mathematical word problems will play a crucial role in preparing materials for the contest with:
--Contest Problems Creation: Propose and create 5-6 unique and creative challenging math word problems and relevant datasets (if applicable) that aligns with grade level appropriate skills, content standards, specified theme, and contest goals.
--Problem Review & Feedback: Provide feedback and collaborate with challenge staff to evaluate created contest problems, sample solutions for the answer key, and provide constructive feedback, tips, and suggested materials for the HMP Teacher’s Guide. Review and edit final drafts of Contest word problems for accuracy, coherence, and mathematical rigor. Identify any errors, ambiguities, or inconsistencies and propose necessary revisions. 

Expected Time Commitment & Compensation
$200 for an estimated 10 total hours May-July 2025: 2 hours of virtual meetings; 8 hours of content development, review, and feedback

Role Timeline (tentative)
--Deadline to apply: May 5, 2025
--Virtual Meeting #1 week of  May 19 (exact date + time TBD)
--Virtual Meeting #2 week of June 9 (exact date + time TBD)
--Completion of materials development: July 15, 2025
--Compensation awarded: July 31, 2025

Eligibility & Qualifications:
--Bachelor's degree in middle school math education or a closely related field (teaching certificate or license preferred)
--Recent experience (within the last 5 years) and expertise working with middle school students in the United States and its territories in mathematics education and mathematical word problems at the middle school level
--Strong knowledge of middle school math curriculum and content standards, including relevant problem-solving techniques and strategies
--Strong creative skills in creating challenging, multi-step, engaging word problems that uniquely target grade-level appropriate skills 
--Excellent verbal and written communication skills to provide clear explanations and constructive feedback
--Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to ensure accurate problem analysis and review
--Passion for mathematics and a desire to inspire and motivate students in their mathematical journey through engagement
--Coaching Eligibility Note: Please note that your participation in content development will prevent you from coaching any teams in the contest for the 2025-26 HMP in accordance with the rules of the Contest.

job_title: Math tutoring needed
job_description:
Looking for a math tutor with expertise in the following fields.
1. Linear and Non-Linear Equations:
Solving systems of linear equations (substitution, elimination, and graphing methods).
Understanding and solving quadratic equations using factoring, completing the square, and the quadratic formula.
Working with inequalities and systems of inequalities.
2. Polynomials and Rational Expressions:
Operations with polynomials (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division).
Factoring polynomials and solving polynomial equations.
Simplifying rational expressions and solving rational equations.
3. Exponents and Radicals:
Understanding laws of exponents (product rule, quotient rule, power rule).
Simplifying expressions with exponents.
Working with square roots and higher-order radicals.
4. Functions:
Understanding types of functions (linear, quadratic, exponential, and others).
Function notation and evaluating functions.
Domain and range of functions.
Operations on functions (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division).
5. Graphing:
Graphing linear and quadratic functions.
Understanding transformations of graphs (shifting, stretching, reflecting).
Working with piecewise functions.
Analyzing intercepts and asymptotes.
6. Logarithmic and Exponential Functions:
Understanding the relationship between logarithms and exponents.
Solving exponential and logarithmic equations.
Applications of exponential growth and decay (e.g., population growth, radioactive decay).
7. Sequences and Series:
Working with arithmetic and geometric sequences.
Using formulas for nth terms and sums of sequences.
Understanding the concept of convergence in series.
8. Trigonometry (if applicable):
Basic trigonometric ratios (sine, cosine, tangent).
Solving right triangles.
Understanding the unit circle and graphing trigonometric functions.
9. Matrices and Determinants (in more advanced courses):
Basic matrix operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication).
Finding the determinant and inverse of matrices.
Applications in solving systems of linear equations.
10. Advanced Geometry (if applicable):
Coordinate geometry (distance formula, midpoint formula, slope of a line).
Conic sections (parabolas, circles, ellipses, hyperbolas).
Basic trigonometry applied to geometric problems.
11.  and Probability:
Understanding descriptive  (mean, median, mode, standard deviation).
Probability concepts, including combinations and permutations.
Basic  analysis and interpreting data from graphs.
12. Word Problems and Applied Math:
Translating real-world problems into mathematical models.
Solving word problems involving rate, time, distance, mixture problems, and more.
Financial math (interest, loans, savings, investments).
13. Critical Thinking and Problem Solving:
Developing strategies to tackle unfamiliar problems.
Identifying patterns and using logic and reasoning to solve complex problems.

3 day session 
Last day to study 4/6/25

job_title: Build a  Warehouse: Kafka → PostgreSQL ELT Pipeline w/ dbt + Superset (Multi-Tenant SaaS)
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
Project Overview:
We are a SaaS company with a multi-tenant architecture and Kafka-based event pipelines. We are looking for a skilled   to implement an ELT system using:
 - Kafka (event source)
 - Kafka Connect (for streaming  into a central warehouse)
 - PostgreSQL (as the reporting warehouse)
 - dbt (for transformation and normalization)
 - Superset (for reports and non-developer-friendly reporting)

Project Goals:
- Deliver a reliable Kafka → PostgreSQL pipeline using Kafka Connect
- Build clean analytics models using dbt
- Enable our non-technical staff to build reusable, tenant-aware reports in Superset

Current Architecture:
- Each of the 23 microservices (Account, Commerce, etc.) has its own PostgreSQL DB
- Each tenant has its own schema/namespace
- All services emit Kafka events when DB records change
- We are deploying a dedicated PostgreSQL instance as a reporting warehouse

Scope of Work
Phase 0 – Warehouse Schema Design
- Propose and define the initial schema structure for the central reporting PostgreSQL warehouse
- Includes raw Kafka-ingested tables and normalized dbt models
- Should support multi-tenant structure (e.g., tenant_id column, single schema vs schema-per-tenant)
- Design for scalability across services (e.g., account_users, commerce_orders)
- Set up required schemas/namespaces (e.g., raw, staging, analytics)
- Ensure naming conventions and structure are dbt- and Superset-friendly
- Review schema plan with our team before implementation
- Document decisions and structure for handoff

Phase 1 – Initial Backfill (One-Time Load)
- Connect to each service PostgreSQL database (e.g., Account, Commerce)
- Extract historical  from each tenant schema within those databases
- Load the extracted  into the appropriate tables in the reporting PostgreSQL warehouse
- Normalize field types and formats to match Kafka-ingested  for consistency
- Ensure tenant_id and source_service fields are included
- Automate this step as a repeatable script or process in case re-runs are needed
- Document the process clearly

Phase 2 – Kafka Connect to PostgreSQL
- Set up Kafka Connect using open-source connectors
- Configure sinks for multiple topics into the central PostgreSQL warehouse
- Ensure tenant context (tenant_id) is preserved in target tables
- Document topic-to-table mappings

Phase 3 – dbt Modeling
- Create and configure a clean, modular dbt project
- Write initial models to transform raw event  into curated tables (E.g., users, orders, subscriptions)
- Normalize fields across services where applicable
- Add documentation and basic  tests

Phase 4 – Superset Charts/Table Reports
- Connect Superset to the reporting warehouse
- Create example dashboards with filters for:
   - Date ranges
   - Tenant selection
   - Service-specific views
- Recommend best practices for access control (row-level or embedding strategies)

Desired Experience
- Kafka Connect (sink connectors, JDBC, PostgreSQL)
- dbt (including incremental models, Jinja templating, modular structure)
- PostgreSQL (for schema design and indexing in a warehouse context)
- Superset configuration and dashboard setup
- Experience with multi-tenant  structures is highly preferred

Current Workflow:
I receive a daily email containing routes and route information for the following day.


I manually reply to this email, assigning specific teams to each route.


I then send individual emails to each team member with their assigned route and details.


I wait for their confirmation (Yes/No) via email.


Upon receiving a "Yes," I manually update to each of their respective Google Sheets calendar with the confirmed assignments.


Desired Automation:
After I send the assignment email:


Automatically parse the email to extract team assignments and route details.


Send individual emails to each team member with their specific route information.


Monitor their email responses for confirmations.


Automatically update the Google Sheets calendar upon receiving a "Yes."


Notify me if a team member declines (responds with "No") so I can reassign the route.


I believe Make.com would be suitable for this automation, given its capabilities with Gmail and Google Sheets integrations.

I will continue to manually assign routes and send the initial assignment email.


The automation should trigger based on my sent assignment emails.


I'm open to suggestions if you believe another tool or approach would be more effective.

job_title: Enterprise Network Engineer & Developer for MQTT Communication Troubleshooting
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
Description:
We are a small tech company specializing in 3D printing workflows using the Bambu Labs X1C printer. Our current challenge involves networking limitations that prevent consistent file transfer from our proprietary software to the printer—especially in segmented enterprise networks such as those found in universities and hospitals.

The Problem:
Our software stack is built using Electron, Node.js, and . Files are sliced and sent to the printer via MQTT, but the Bambu X1C and the sending laptop must share the same first 3 octets of the IP address (e.g., 192.168.0.x) in order to communicate freely. This becomes an issue on segmented networks where the devices are on different subnets (e.g., 192.168.1.x and 192.168.2.x) despite being able to ping each other and connect via the same router.
This creates a poor user experience, requiring manual IT intervention in otherwise controlled environments.

What We Need:
We’re looking for a network-savvy developer to help us:
•	Diagnose why MQTT communication is blocked across subnets despite general connectivity.
•	Design a workaround or solution to allow our printers and laptops to communicate seamlessly across subnets.
•	Potentially refactor or modify our MQTT communication method to improve reliability in segmented networks.
•	Guide long-term network architecture recommendations for broader device deployments in enterprise environments.
Requirements:
•	Strong experience in enterprise networking (subnetting, VLANs, firewalls, etc.)
•	Experience with MQTT protocol, specifically with cross-subnet communication.
•	Proficiency in Node.js, , and ideally Electron apps.
•	Comfortable working with IoT devices and troubleshooting hardware/software comms.
•	Bonus if familiar with Linux-based slicing servers or 3D printing workflows.

Deliverables:
•	Technical assessment and recommendation document.
•	Working proof-of-concept demonstrating cross-subnet MQTT communication (if feasible).
•	Optional: Code modifications or configuration scripts.

To Apply:
Please share:
•	Relevant experience solving similar network communication problems.
•	Your background in MQTT, Node.js, and network engineering.
•	Examples of cross-subnet or IoT deployments you’ve worked on.
•	Your availability and estimated turnaround for the initial diagnostic phase.

job_title: Tweak Existing Raspberry Pi5 Image to Resolve a Few Issues
project_duration: Less than 1 month, Less than 30 hrs/week
job_description:
I run a live trivia game at several bars. Patrons play free on their phone by creating an account at a web site. I plug a Raspberry Pi5 into a TV/monitor in the bar to display questions/leaderboards/digital signage, etc.

Here's how I setup the Pi. I write the image to the SD card then insert the SD card into and start the Pi. It's connected to my Ethernet and it is programmed to load Chrome and immediately load my trivia web site. At this point I type in the bar's login/pass credentials and click a remember me box and the game logs in and starts "playing at their location".

I unhook it and either mail or take it to the bar. When I plug it in it can't connect to a network so it shows a QC code that I scan with my phone and the box creates a captive portal that allows you to see available networks and enter the password thereby allowing the box to then run from the client's network.

This all works very well. However, when a HARD restart is experienced by either a power outage, or unplugging power to the PI, the system will load and either not connect to the network AND/OR lose the login credentials/cookies. I have "solved" this by giving clients a Pi remote that when the power button is pressed it does a SOFT restart and corrects the issue.

I need to solve this issue as well as find someone who can make sure this box REMAINS connected to WiFi by any means necessary. I understand losing the signal completely is a different story, but it just needs more resiliance. 

I can share the existing code when a candidate is selected. I don't believe this will be a long/major undertaking so more than a week is probably overkill.

Thanks for your time!

job_title: Build a Serverless Smartsheet‑to‑PDF Pipeline ( + AWS Lambda)
job_description:
Project Overview

Our nonprofit produces a large grant reports every month with multiple points of entry. Staff upload evidence files (PDFs, docs) and update a brief narrative directly in Smartsheet. I want a hands‑off solution that:

1. Listens for row edits/attachments via a Smartsheet webhook
2. Pulls the changed rows, fills a multi‑line “Narrative” form field inside a PDF template
3. Merges that freshly filled template with all supporting PDFs—in contract order, with coversheets
4. Drops the final packet into an S3 bucket & re‑attaches it to a “Reports” sheet row
5. Keeps every version in S3 and logs each run (timestamp, row count, file size)

Once built, any staff edit should automatically trigger a brand‑new merged PDF—no manual clicks or Adobe Acrobat needed.

Responsibilities & Deliverables
Design IaC (CDK/SAM) for API Gateway →  Lambda → S3

Implement secure Smartsheet + AWS credentials with Secrets Manager

Write the Lambda:

Fetch changed rows & attachments via smartsheet--sdk

Fill the PDF template using Adobe PDF Services SDK or pdfrw  

Merge PDFs with pypdf, add bookmarks, name file Attachment_VII_YYYY‑MM.pdf

Upload to S3 (versioned) and attach back to Smartsheet

Basic error handling & CloudWatch logs; SNS/e‑mail alert on failure

README + setup docs so we can redeploy if needed (GitHub repo)

Hand‑off walk‑through (1 video call)

Ideal Freelancer:
Solid  (async/requests, PDF libs)

Production experience with AWS Lambda, API Gateway, S3, IAM

Familiar with webhooks & third‑party APIs (Smartsheet a plus)

Writes clean, commented code and clear docs

Project Type & Timeline:
Kick‑off as soon as hired; target delivery ≤ 3 weeks

Milestones: architecture approval → working Lambda on dev sheet → prod cut‑over

I am also open to helpful suggestions or guidance.

job_title: Create Automated LinkedIn Content Generator Automation
job_description:
📌 Overview (Revised for Clarity)
I’m building a system that automatically generates LinkedIn posts using GPT-4, based on my brand voice and content strategy.

I want it to run on autopilot—generating one post per weekday—without me needing to manually feed it ideas every time. That said, I do want the flexibility to add my own ideas when I choose.

The system should:

Pull ideas from a Notion database (which may include manually entered ideas or content pulled from meetings/notes)

Send them to GPT-4 using a custom LinkedIn prompt I provide

Save the draft in a second Notion database for me to review, edit, and post

I'm looking for someone who can build this using Zapier, Notion, and OpenAI—and deliver a clean, reliable system I can use and later offer to clients.

🛠️ What I Need You to Build:
1. Automation Flow (Zapier)

Scheduled trigger: once per weekday

Pull the next available idea from a Notion Content Seeds database

If nothing is available, system can either pause or use a backup/default theme bank

Send idea + metadata (Post Type, Tone) to OpenAI using a custom LinkedIn prompt I’ll provide (includes voice, structure, CTA logic, etc.)

Output: Create or update a Notion record in the LinkedIn Drafts database

Fields include: Content Idea, AI Draft, Tone, Post Type, Status

Mark the seed as “Used” with timestamp

2. Two Notion Databases

Content Seeds

Stores raw snippets, notes, voice memos (manually or automatically sourced)

Fields: Idea Snippet, Post Type Tag, Tone Hint, Source, Status, Date Added

LinkedIn Draft Generator

Receives the AI-generated drafts

Fields: Content Idea, AI Draft, Final Copy, Post Type, Tone, Status, Date Used

3. Integration of My GPT Prompt

I’ll provide a structured prompt that includes:

My LinkedIn content strategy (based on the 4-1-1 rule)

Hook/re-hook formatting

Tone guidance and audience context

You’ll set up the Zap to send dynamic fields into this prompt

🔁 Bonus Features (Ideal but not required):
Option to pull ideas from my meeting notes (Fathom or Google Doc) via Zapier

A fallback system if the Content Seeds database is empty (e.g. random ideas or templates)

✅ Deliverables
Fully functioning Zapier flow (daily post draft automation)

Notion databases set up and connected

OpenAI integration with custom prompt

Simple guide (Notion doc or Loom) to explain how I can edit, review, and reuse the system

🧠 Ideal Background
This project is perfect for someone who has:

Built GPT-powered automation tools before

Experience integrating Notion + Zapier + OpenAI

Familiarity with creator workflows, LinkedIn content, or thought leadership pipelines
